texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou D.  est un jeune  yoffois de 25 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il évolue depuis 2005 dans le secteur du commerce qu’il a choisi par le biais  de son frère commerçant. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques qu’il commercialise. Son objectif est de renforcer son stock de produits et mieux développer son commerce. Ainsi l’accroissement de ses bénéfices pourra l’aider à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a young man from Yoff. He is 25 years old, single, and has no children. Since 2005, he has been involved in sales, a choice made through his brother, a merchant.  

He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since July 2010. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to purchase cosmetic products for resale. His goal is to increase his stocks and further develop his business. The anticipated boost in his profits will help him improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Strengthen his working capital

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran A. K. is a member of a poor family living in  Kasur, which is a mid-sized city famous for its sweetmeat in Pakistan. She lives in Rukan Pura, which is a small housing colony in Kasur, where she has a small house consisting of two rooms. Sughran is a very talented woman. She owns and operates an embroidery business in her home to supplement the income of her family. She mainly receives order from her neighboring clients and completes the dresses on time.  Her husband, A. K., has a business of selling bedsheets. He buys the bedsheets from the city multan and sells them at the local markets of Kasur for a good profit.  Sughran has two sons. Her elder son is involved in an embroidery business and her younger son is in school. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, her son will buy an embroidery machine, which will help him to complete larger orders on time and to work more efficiently. Sughran is very confident about the growth of her son’s business after this loan investment.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Juana Yaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana V. es comerciante y su actividad es la venta de abarrotaría, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “mini pulpería las Acacias” su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y cuenta con 1 año de experiencia en la administración del mismo, anteriormente la sra. Juana se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero por asuntos personales decidió cambiar de negocio.
En el tiempo que doña Juana tiene de administrar su nuevo negocio a adquirido mucha clientela por su amabilidad, la ubicación de su negocio, la variedad de producto que tiene y los precios que son un poco más bajos que los demás negocios de la zona.
Doña Juana esta casada y con su esposo concibieron tres hijos, los que en la actualidad están cursando sus estudios primarios, juntos con su esposo han logrado salir adelante con la frente en alto y ofreciendoles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana V. is a merchant who sells groceries. Her business operates under the name “Mini Pulpería Las Acacias” and is located in her home. She has one year of experience running her business. Sra. Juana previously sold clothing, but she decided to change businesses for personal reasons.

During the time Doña Juana has managed her new business, she has acquired many customers because of her kindness, the location of her business, the variety of products she offers, and the fact that her prices are slightly lower than other businesses in the area.

Doña Juana is married. She and her husband have three children who are enrolled in elementary school. Together they have been able to get ahead with the heads held high and provide a good future for their children.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica una zona agrícola ubicada una hora y media al sureste de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales menores en algunos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta diariamente de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya están completamente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive y eventualmente los vende en una feria que suele realizarse una vez por semana en el vecino distrito de Cayaltí.

Julio desea adquirir más animales menores y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, sobretodo en la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales se incrementa, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Julio es una persona bastante responsable y muy entregada a su familia y a su negocio. Las personas que le conoce le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Julio is 65 years old, is married, and resides with his family in the agricultural zone of the Nueva Arica district, located one and a half hours southeast of the city of Chiclayo. 

He has small animals in some corrals located behind his home. He feeds them daily with grain and grass, and when they are completely grown he offers to sell them to businesspeople who often visit the area where he lives. He eventually sells them at a market that is set up once a week in the neighboring district of Cayaltí. 

Julio would like to acquire more small animals and balanced feed in order to expand his business and increase his sales, especially in the Christmas season since this is when the demand for his animals increases. For this reason, he thought it would be a good opportunity to apply for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa. 

Julio is a very responsible person who is very devoted to his family and his business. The people who know him have much esteem and respect for him.

loans.use: To buy small animals and balanced feed in order to expand his business raising and selling the animals.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside junto a su familia en el anexo San Antonio de Padua del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural de pobladores bastante humildes dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. El cría ovejas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia al sostenimiento de su economía.

Francisco desea ampliar sus corrales y adquirir alimento balanceado, de modo que sus ovejas puedan criarse de mejor modo y pueda percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Francisco is 41 years old, single, and has no dependent children.  He lives with his family in the San Antonio de Padua annex in the district of Lambayeque, a rural area where people mostly work in agriculture and raise animals.

For more than three years, he has worked raising and selling young animals.  He raises sheep in an area located in the back part of his home.  He feeds them natural grasses and when they have reached a good level of development, he sells them to merchants that visit the area where he lives.  The income he earns from this activity meets his personal expenses and allows him to help his family financially.

Francisco would like to expand his corrals and buy balanced feed so that his sheep can develop better and he can earn more money from their sales.  To do this, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Expand his corrals and purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 45 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga en una camioneta. El brinda este servicio a los agricultores y comerciantes de la zona. El distrito de Olmos, está constituido principalmente por pequeños centros poblados que distan mucho entre sí, por lo que el negocio de transporte de carga les permite llevar los productos que desean comercializar al pueblo central, muchas veces situado hasta a dos horas de los lugares donde viven. Manuel trata de brindar su servicio de la mejor manera posible ya que de ello depende el sustento de su familia.

Manuel desea realizar algunas reparaciones a su vehículo así como brindarle mantenimiento. Con ello planea asegurarse que este funcione correctamente y pueda seguir siéndole útil para desarrollar sus actividades. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel, 45, lives with his wife and children in Olmos, a rural area in the Peruvian province of Lambayeque, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Manuel operates a small trucking business.  His customers are local farmers and tradesmen.  Olmos is a district of mostly small towns, all far from one another, so transportation services are important to sellers who have to carry their products to market in towns that are as much as two hours away from where they live.  Manuel tries to provide the best possible service because his family's livelihood depends on the business.  

Manuel is applying for a loan so that he can maintain his truck.  He wants to ensure that the vehicle runs properly so that he can continue to use it for developing his business.  He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,000 new soles loan so that he can complete the necessary maintenance work.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance for trucking business.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel S. V., tiene 49 años, es casada, vive con los hijos y la esposa, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 10 hijos de diferentes edades. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Juana Isabel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Farma - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable.

Le gusta hacer amigos
texts.en:
Juana Isabel S. V., age 49, is married and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 10 children of different ages.

The members of the V.R.C. Ciudadela Los Angeles are located in the Los Angeles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice.

Juana Isabel works in agriculture sowing corn. She purchases her products in Farma-Agro and sells in the same location.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to have a stable job.

She enjoys making friends.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 53 years old, married and has eight children who are between 7 and 26. His wife works as a farmer.

Fred sells various items such as rice, juice, mineral water and sugar. He has been running his business for 29 years. Fred has requested this loan to buy more rice and sugar. 

He hopes to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children from the profits he anticipates to get from the business. He dreams to get more loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca O., from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental, is 45 years old, separated from her spouse, and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture buying and raising cattle for sale and also buying and selling vegetables such as eggplants and squash. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting her third loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional animals such as pigs and chickens. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals such as pigs and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gourds and squashes for making more handicraft objects

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has four adult children.

To make a living, Zenaida plants and harvests flowers for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. 

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik is an economist by trade but his family's income comes from his food shop. Gagik lives with his wife, also an economist, his parents (a teacher and a bus driver), and his two young children.  Gagik has applied for this loan to purchase food items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: stock his grocery store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells AVON & Natasha products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of AVON & Natasha products to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the AVON & Natasha products business for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marlyn aspires to save money to expand her business and send one of her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of AVON & Natasha products to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul M. M. has operated his retail shop for nine years in Kaloleni Market in Tala town. He earns an income of KES. 10,000 per month. He is married to Eva Mwikali who is a teacher, and they have four children.

He has good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his third loan which he plans to use to add stock for resale, e.g. rice, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks.

In future he  plans to grow his business and open another shop and eventually be successful in business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: MR Kokou  a 28 ans et comme profession principale il est Administrateur Réseau .il est célibataire et aimerait avoir une vie stable et bien assise  avant de se lancer dans la vie de couple. Il a une activité parallèle à sa profession celle de la vente de basins et ce crédit lui permettra  d’acheter en quantité cet article pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
texts.en: Mr. Kokou is 28 and his main job is working as a network administrator. He is single and would like to have a good, stable lifestyle before he marries. He has a secondary job at the same time as his profession, that of selling lengths of damask cloth ("bazin"). This loan will allow him to buy a good quantity of these fabrics so as to satisfy the needs of his clientele.

loans.use: to buy lengths of good quality "bazin" (damask cloth).

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en: Kevina is a single mother of two children aged two months and three years. She has no other dependants and lives with her children in  a rented home in Hoima Uganda. Her family goal is to build a house for her children and for three years she has been running a charcoal business. She started by selling timber but later changed to the charcoal business. She faces a challenge of where to burn the charcoal since the Ministry of Forestry evicts them from the forests and her desire is to buy land and plant trees. Kevina needs the loan to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
EL señor Ernesto vive en la cuidad Managua Nicaragua.
El señor   es trabajador honesto con mucho deseo de superación. el señor se presento a nuestras oficina para solicitar un préstamo para hacer mejoras en su vivienda y  asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia .       
La inversión del préstamos para la compra de materiales de construcción  como  arena , cemento, piedra, bloque. Estos será invertido en la ampliación de un habitación para sus hijos
texts.en:
Ernesto lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  He is an honest working man who has a great desire to improve himself.  He came to our office to request a loan so that he could make some improvements to his home and thereby improve his family's living conditions.

Ernesto will invest this loan in buying building supplies such as sand, cement, stone and blocks.  They will be used to extend a bedroom for his children.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida de 66 años se siente muy feliz por encontrarse en su propia casa en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su enfoque misional de construir comunidades sostenibles. Allí tiene su propio negocio llamado “Comercializadora La Niña Cande”  donde vende refrescos, pollo, carnes frías y mecatos, en un punto de venta que está gradualmente posicionándose en la medida en que crezca esta comunidad, que planea un número de 25 mil viviendas, por eso su proyección es firme. 
Cándida vivía en San José otro municipio del departamento de Bolívar de donde vino en condiciones de desplazamiento y perdió todos su semovientes, así fue que se instaló en Cartagena a construir suevos sueños y gradualmente ha progresado, consiguió su propia casa y una forma de generar ingresos mediante un negocio, con el que sueña hacerlo crecer, aumentando su capital de trabajo y con ello sus clientes; su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  en mayor volumen cajas de refrescos y bebidas, mecatos carnes frías y productos de la canasta familiar, que últimamente solicitan las amas de casa y son de rotación rápida. Su meta más adelante es adicionarle una panadería a su negocio, porque este oficio lo maneja perfectamente y hay un buen potencial de crecimiento en esta zona donde aún no existe una.
texts.en:
66 year-old Cándida is very happy to be living in her own home which is located in the Ciudad Bicentenario macro-housing project which is administered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of their social focus on creating sustainable communities.  Cándida has her own business there called "Comercializadora La Niña Cande” where she sells soft drinks, chicken, cold cuts and packed lunches from a sales location which is gradually positioning itself as the community grows.  There are plans to build 25,000 homes within the community and so the projection for her business is solid.

Cándida used to live in San José, another town within Bolívar department.  She was uprooted from there and lost all her livestock so she set up home in Cartagena in order to build new dreams.  She has gradually made progress.  She has obtained her own home and a way of making a living through a business.  She dreams of growing her business, increasing her working capital and also her number of customers.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Cándida has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy crates of soda and drinks, packed lunches, cold cuts and essential household products in larger quantities.  Housewives have been requesting these products recently and they have a quick turnover.  Cándida's goal for the future is to add a bakery to her business because she can manage that trade perfectly and there is a good growth potential in her area as there is still no bakery there.

loans.use: to buy sodas and soft drinks, packed lunches, cold cuts and essential household products in larger volumes

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
"Jovenes Emprendedores" es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado  07 socias  todas viven en Ventanilla Callao  la Sra. Ofelia es la presidenta del grupo  y como tal espera desempeñar una buena labor, el negocio al cual ella se dedica es la venta de ropa  como polos medias  y zapatillas, su trabajo lo maneja desde su casa ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos ella trabaja a pedido y les ofrece facilidades de pago a sus clientas con el producto de su trabajo ha podido mejorar su casa la que quiere terminar muy pronto por que tiene en mente poner algunos cuartos  en alquiler,  el  préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilitara lo utilizara para comprar ropa de invierno como chompas,casacas y panatlones, estas prendas tienen mucha demanda en esta epoca.  

   * Frank es el joven de la izquierda.
texts.en:
"Jovenes Emprendedores" is a new group and it is made up of 7 members, all of whom live in the city of Callao. Ofelia is the president of the group and as such she endeavors to do a good job. Her business is clothing sales, including polo shirts, tights, and ladies' shoes. She manages her business from her house, offering products to her neighbors and friends. She works by taking orders and she offers payment options to her clients. As a product of her work she has been able to improve her house. She wants to finish building it very soon because her plan is to rent out a few rooms. The loan from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help to purchase winter clothing, especially because it is in high demand during this season.

** Frank is the young man in the left.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 70 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación y venta de helados, ella tiene una tienda donde vende helados, barquillos y también distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que existe en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los helados y los barquillos como frutas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 70 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business making ice-cream to sell.  She has a store where she sells frozen treats and ice-cream cones.  She also distributes to various stores in Urubamba province.  She supports her children through this business.  She wants to expand and improve the ice-cream business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the frozen treats and ice-cream, like fruit.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream making supplies.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes vendeuses, leur activité principale est l'achat et la vente de mangue.
elles maitrisent l'activité et bénéficient d'une bonne clientele. Ces femmes ont une marge bénéficiaire de 50 pour cent de leur chiffre d'affaire. Avec ce fiancement elle verront leur niveau de vie augmenter et de pouvoir soutenir leur mari dans les depenses quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
This group is composed of five businesswomen whose main activity is buying and selling mangoes. 

They are good at their business and have the advantage of having a good clientele. These women have a profit margin of 50 % of their turnover. With this loan they will improve their living conditions and be able to help their husbands with daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Mabinty. She is married to a tailor and has five children aged 4, 7, 11, 16, and 19. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because she is living in the city where educational facilities are much more improved than the villages where their parents live. 

In 2004, Mabinty established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed a source of income to help her husband support their home. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,050,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mabinty has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,800,000, 50 pieces of different types of jeans @ Le45,000,pay transportation and taxes . 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mabinty plans to open a big shop and build a dwelling house for her family and make sure her children go through university. 

She serves customers around the city and the surrounding villages. She normally buys her goods from Freetown and Guinea. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted wax cotton - one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,800,000 , 50 pieces of different types of jeans @ Le45,000. transportation and taxes

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: María auxiliadora se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura, hace más de 40 años que tiene este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientas depositan bastante confianza en las prendas que elabora. Ella tiene experiencia porque anteriormente trabajaba en un tienda de venta de telas fue cuando terminó de trabajar en esa tienda que decidió trabajar en su propio negocio. El objetivo del préstamo es para la compra de telas, tijeras, centímetro, agujas, alfileres, hilo y dedales.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora provides sewing service; she's had this business for more than 40 years.  The majority of her clients have great confidence in the clothes that she makes.  She is experienced because prior to this she worked in a store selling fabrics.  It was when she finished working in this store that she decided to have her own business.

The purpose of this loan is to buy fabric, scissors, tape measure, needles, pins, thread and thimbles.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, scissors, tape measure, needles, pins, thread and thimbles.

loans.name: Edwin Adalid

texts.es:
el sr. Edwin tiene 27 años de edad se dedica a la caficultura, tiene mas de (3) años realizando dicha actividad productiva, tambien se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y frijoles, y con estas actividades a logrado salir adelante junto con su familia, ya que generan los ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, en el que vive con sus 2 hijos y su pareja.
 Edwin solicita un credito, el cual será destinado para la compra de una planta de energía solar, debido a que en el lugar donde vive no cuentan con este servicio básico y le seria de mucha utilidad en su hogar ya que no tendrá que seguir alumbrándose con velas, candiles y rajas de ocotote que es lo que han utilizado durante todo este tiempo, nos comento que sus hijos se han visto afectados por el humo que este tipo de productos producen. dicha planta de energia solar vendra a darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and has spent more than 3 years as a coffee grower. He also cultivates corn and beans. He has been able to get ahead, together with his family, through engaging in these activities, since they generate sufficient income to cover household expenses for himself, his partner and their two sons.

Edwin is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system because they do not have basic services in his area and solar energy would be very useful, since he would not have to continue using candles, oil lamps and torches for illumination in his home, which is what they have been using all of this time. He notes that his children have been affected by the smoke produced by these types of products. A solar energy system will enable his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 49 years old and married to Dorothy. Together they have three children. James has been operating a general store for the last four years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to move into a spacious shop and add more stock of flour, cooking fat, salt, rice, sugar, and bar soap to the business.

In the future, he wants to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to move into a spacious shop and add more stock of flour, cooking fat, salt, rice, sugar, and bar soap.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hardworking businessman who is 54 years old. He is married and blessed with 4 children who are still in school. For the last 3 years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also engages in dairy farming and selling timber to earn more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a van. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a power saw for his timer selling business.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for his timber selling business

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband who is a rickshaw driver and the only breadwinner in the family.   With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw whose engine is creating problems and needs repair and maintenance work urgently otherwise it will seize up.  He has been driving his rickshaw for the past 20 years and Tahira is hopeful that this investment will not only help him save his business asset but also help him make more profit by providing better quality transport services to his passengers.  Tahira doesn’t have any children and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tahira.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas se denomina un buen grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Reinalda contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el quinto ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Reinalda se dedica a la venta D. comidas D. todo tipo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, ya que según ellos mismos, la señora cocina muy bien. Gracias a su negocio pueD. ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y darle a su familia las condiciones mínimas para una vida digna y decorosa. En vista D. que le va muy bien, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. carne, fideos, condimentos, verduras y otros, los cuales son los ingredientes esenciales D. sus comidas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas (Active Women) is a group of good women formed in the city of Itá.  It was formed thanks to the efforts of Sra. Reinalda, the current president.  She contacted the loan counselor during a weekly meeting of Fundacion Paraguaya that the organization was having in the area.  Once she approached the foundation’s counseling office, Sra. Reinalda succeeded in bringing together 17 women whom she had met.  They work together comfortably with unity and solidarity and are already in the 5th loan cycle working within the program.

Sra. Reinalda is engaged in the sale of meals of all types.  She says that she has many customers since, according to them, she cooks very well.  Thanks to her business she is able to help with household expenses and give her family the minimum conditions for a dignified and proper life.  

Since things are going well she wants to continue investing in her business.  That’s why she is applying for a loan in order to purchase meat, noodles, condiments, vegetables, and other foods which are essential ingredients of her meals.

loans.use: to purchase meat, noodles, condiments, vegetables, and other foods.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 32 years. She is 54 years old and married to Kuria. They have one school-going child.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan funds to buy fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Joyce hopes to expand and improve her farming business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and three daughters; her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Manal wants to make some repairs to her house such as painting, changing tiles and changing windows and doors but she hasn't enough money so she needs a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Manal gets the loan, she will be able to pay for repairing her house and her family will live in better conditions. Manal is a conservative woman, so her husband Alaa' is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for house repairs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Neither of them are in school. She has a business of selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Adhieu

texts.en:
Adhieu is a 42-year-old married woman with no children. She has been selling food in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Adhieu has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase biscuits, onions, and rice to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, onions, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Liceth

texts.es: La señora Liceth es comerciante de ropa de niños. El crédito que requiere  es para aumento de capital ya que comprara más ropa de niños y así tener más variedad y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año para incrementar sus ingresos. Liceth es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa en anticrético  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Liceth es cliente de Impro desde Julio de 2010 y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Liceth is a merchant who sells children’s clothing. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy more children’s clothing. This will enable her to have more variety so that she can take advantage of the year-end festivities to increase her earnings. Liceth is single and has two children. She lives in a rented house in the September 14th District in the city of La Paz.

Liceth has been a client of IMPRO since July 2010 and this will be the second time that her loan will be referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell during the year-end season.

loans.name: La Esperanza 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of her group, La Esperanza 1, 3 & 4 (Hope). She lives in the city of La Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. Rosa has three children, two of whom live together with her and her long-term partner in one of the rural areas surrounding this tourist city. Most of this sugar town's population are Haitians who emigrated and settled in to work in the sugar cane industry.

Rosa has been running her business for around three years and this is her third loan with Esperanza Internacional. She sells miscellaneous products like clothes, bread and gasoline. She sells them in her home located on the main road in the town, where many people pass by and buy her products. She started her business with some capital she saved by working in the city. With her business profits, she will be able to expand her sales and plans to build a locale for her business.

Her most difficult challenges are to buy her house in the city and to have an improved business. She wants to be able to send her children to attend university. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy different products like clothes, flour, butter and gasoline

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar y leche al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working in her grocery store business. She sells rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. With this business, she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to enlarge and improve her store. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar and milk wholesale to stock her grocery store. 

This member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and milk wholesale to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Swzan

texts.en:
Swzan is a 37-year-old married woman, who has four family members, from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture for the guest room.

In the future, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and she is working on tamales sales and Mexican foods, she has 5 years of experience in her business and her clients have increased year to year, for that reason Carmen is motivated to increase her capacity to produce foods. She has 2 children, who she loves so much and for them she has to work very hard to cover their necessities like food, clothes and studies. Married with Mr. Juan who works in a private company and their salary is not enough to cover the family expenses; Carmen is very worried to go on.

She requires your support; from that way she can offer to her children a good education and a better quality of life. She needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase raw material for the production of her foods, because these next Christmas season, the Tamales is one of the favorite Mexican meal and Carmen hopes excellent sales in the same way. In a term of 3 months, she plans to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Carmen tiene 40 años y se dedica a la venta de tamales y comidas mexicanas, tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio y sus clientes han aumentado año con año, por lo que Carmen esta motivada para aumentar su capacidad de producir comidas. Tiene 2 hijos a quienes adora y por los que tiene que trabajar muy duro para cubrir sus necesidades como alimento, ropa y estudios. Casada con el señor Juan quien trabaja en una empresa privada y su salario no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia la preocupación de Carmen es muy grande.

Ella requiere de tu apoyo para que pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Necesita de un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar insumos para la producción de sus comidas ya que estas próxima temporada navideña, los Tamales son uno de los platillos favoritos de los mexicanos por lo que Carmen espera excelentes ventas para esta temporada. En un término de 3 meses, ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 30 years old, married with 2 children. She is in the hairdressing business. Although she has her own salon, she operates with a single hair-dryer. Her objective therefore is to secure the KIVA loan to purchase two more to able to serve at least 3 clients at a time. She graduated from KRABAN'S TEACH learning sessions in October 2006.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao and her husband, Vang, have 3 children who are going to school in grades 11, 9, and 3. They have 4000 square meters of cassava. Vang is weak so he only works on their land. Thao sells food for breakfast in the morning and sells food from door to door in the afternoon. Additionally, the family raises pigs.

From the family’s new activities, their income increased by $2/person/month so their average income is $10/person/month. Thao repaid a first loan already. Now she wants to borrow $50 for her food-selling business and pig-raising.

loans.use: Petty trade and pig-raising

loans.name: Tamunang

texts.en:
Papa A. is married and has six children. Frequently challenged by sickness, he is determined to work and earn in order to provide for the basic medical needs of his family. In 2006 he took his first loan. He succeeded in repaying it, one hundred percent. He provided his community with palm-wine. Palm wine is sap from palm-tree. It is sweet when it is newly tapped. When fermentation takes place it becomes strong and tastes like beer.  Palm-wine bars are venues where mostly men meet to share breaking news items.

Given a loan of $300, A. plans to increase his stock in the palm-wine business and add new businesses in other to spread his risk and to find out which business is more profitable for him to embark on in the long run. He plans on starting a piggery. He plans to repay his loan in 15 months with sales from his palm-wine investment, which provides daily income.  Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase and retail of palmwine

loans.name: Herlin Wahyuliatini

texts.id:
Herlin owns a small snack stall in the Gilimanuk harbour. Living in her bare minimum house does not discourage her to earn a good living. Herlin has a four year old child and a husband who works as an informal ticket agent in the harbour. With a working capital of 100,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR) Herlin purchase merchandise items in the Gilimanuk market and start selling from 4PM to 2AM, so she could still take care of her family while preparing her merchandise in the following morning. With her own capital, Herlin could earn a profit of 25,000 IDR per day. She kept some of the profit for additional capital and for saving. The loan from DINARI is going to be used to increase her merchandising items so she could gain more profit for her family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Herlin mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Asongan ( Menjual aneka snack dan minuman ) di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Rumahnya yang sederhana dengan dinding batako dan lantai semen tidak membuat Herlin putus asa namun Ia tetap semangat. Herlin mempunyai seorang anak yang berusia 4 tahun dan suaminya bekerja sebagai calo tiket di pelabuhan. Dengan modal sebesar Rp. 100.000.-, Herlin akan membeli barang dagangannya di pasar pagi Gilimanuk dan mulai berjualan pukul 4 sore sampai pukul 2 pagi, sehingga di pagi hari ia bisa mengurus keluarga sambil menyiapkan dagangannya. Dengan modal yang dimilikinya, Herlin mampu mendapat keuntungan Rp. 25.000.- per hari. Keuntungan itu ia sisihkan untuk modal dan juga untuk tabungan. Pinjaman dari DINARI direncanakan untuk menambah barang dagangannya sehingga Herlin bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya

loans.use: To purchase merchandising items such as cigarettes, instant noodles, kleenex, candies, beverages, etc

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is 58 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City and she sells drinks. She spent four months learning her business and has five years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She is a member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is a mother of three children. This young woman was born in 1979. She lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Yegana has sold clothes for three years. Now she requests a loan of $850 to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm R., 65, is married with four children from SiemReap, Cambodia. She currently stays at home cooking food for and taking care of her family. Her husband works at a private company and generally earns only $2 each day. Two of her children must work as well, and are employed by a nearby factory while the rest of whom are married and live separately. Mrs. Morm R. hopes to acquire a loan that will enable her to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. Because the motor-taxi service  is too expensive for her husband and two children to go back and forth from work, she believes a motorcycle would greatly benefit her family financially. Mrs. Morm R. would also like to use the rest of the loan to open a grocery stand in her community. By doing so she hopes to make a profit and supplement her husband and children’s’ incomes in order to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila was born in 1960 and she is a mother of 3 children.  The family lives in the Khachmaz region. Rahila has sold agricultural produce for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy fruits and vegetables for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Agnes' Fanaka E Group

texts.en:
Agnes G., age 37, is married and has five children (ages 21, 19, 19,14 and 12). She sells sarongs, fruits and vegetables which she began one and half years ago. She works from 8am to 6pm daily making a monthly profit of about US$86.

In the past, Agnes has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She hopes for a new loan to start selling fried fish. Agnes will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling charcoal, poultry and wood.

In the picture Agnes is the only lady.

loans.use: To begin selling fried fish at her shop

loans.name: Mujeres Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
The program called the Committee of Enterprising Women is a group of 15 women that is asking for a joint loan that they will pay back together as a group.

This particular group formed after one of the members heard very positive comments from her neighbor about the activities she and her friends had become involved with through the help of Fundación Paraguaya. That is how this group came to be known as “Mujeres Pojoaju” which means “Women taken by the hand” in Guarani language.

The group is made up of 17 women, almost all of them from the same area of the city. They are involved with a variety of activities including the sales of fruits, vegetables, and clothing. Other members work in hair shops and doing cleaning work with a weekly or monthly salary.

The women are asking for a loan of 800,000 to 1,000,000 Guarani for each one of them (approximately $180 - $230 US dollars per person.) They will use the loan to invest in their various activities; buying merchandise or the necessary tools in order to carry out their jobs. Some of the things that they will buy are: clothing, barbershop supplies, fruits, vegetables, and other goods of primary necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

El programa llamado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras es un grupo de mujeres de 15 integrantes como mínimo y que retiran un crédito en forma conjunta y lo pagan de forma solidaria.

Para la formación del presente comité una señora integrante de otro comité comento a una de sus vecinas sobre las ventajas del programa que estaba desarrollando junto con otras amigas en la Fundación Paraguaya. Fue así que nació este grupo llamado “Mujeres Pojoaju” que en el idioma guaraní significa Mujeres tomadas de la mano.

El comité esta constituido por 17 señoras casi todas de la misma zona las señoras tienen actividades diversas como venta de ropas, venta de verduras, frutas, peluquería, despensa, otras trabajan como limpiadoras y cuentan con un ingreso fijo semanal o mensual.

Las señoras retiran un crédito entre G. 800.000 a G.1.000.000 cada una. El crédito lo utilizan para invertirlos en sus diferentes actividades, comprando mercaderías o herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos. Algunas de las cosas que compran son: ropas, materiales de peluquería, frutas, verduras, artículo de primera necesidad y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, barbershop supplies, fruits, vegetables, cleaning products, and other goods.

loans.name: Trois Cocotiers 1 Group

texts.fr:
Trois Cocotiers is a group of women who are inspired by the same desire, and who work to provide local women with the power of decision. The group offers as a primary business the buying and selling of seafood products. This involves buying these highly desired products at the local market and then reselling them at a good price to the local population.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Trois cocotiers est un groupement de femmes animées d'une même volonté et qui oeuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leur milieu. Le groupement se propose une activité principale qui consiste à l'achat et à la vente de produits halieutiques. il s'agit d'acheter les produits halieutiques trés sollicités dans le marché local et les revendre à bon prix aux populations locales.

loans.use: Achat et revente de produits halieutiques

loans.name: Onwugbenu

texts.en: G. Onwugbenu lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials. It took her a year to acquire this skill and she has been in this business since 1998. Her tailoring materials are well arranged in different, attractive colors, which distinguishes her from other small-scale entrepreneurs. Mrs. Onwugbenu is 38 years old and is married with 2 children. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more tailoring material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience Ogbemuudia is 39 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Patience is a fashion designer by training. She studied fashion design for 3 years and she started her own business in 1995.

She need a loan of $875 USD to buy more clothes and tailoring materials to sell.

Patience is a LAPO client. She says "thank you" to all that made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Hakly

texts.en:
Mr. Hakly S., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Hoy Chhaum, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have six children, one son and five daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker and another is studying at a local school.

Mr. Hakly has been a cook for ten years, a skill he learned from his neighbor. He cooks for wedding parties and other ceremonies in his nearby villages, while Mrs. Hoy stays at home to take care of the children. Hakly is in the process of repairing his house but lacks the money to buy zinc to roof his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 150 USD to purchase materials to roof his house.

loans.use: To purchase material to roof his house

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru: Раджабов Махмадсаид житель города Душанбе. Возраст 27 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже три года работает таксистом внутри города. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы установить газовое оборудование. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Если он установит газовое оборудование его доходы возрастут , кроме того он сможет снизить стоимость проезда , тем самым помогать населению
texts.en:
Mahmadsaid R. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 27 years old, married and has one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for the last three years. He plans to receive a loan and use it to upgrade his vehicle to run on gas. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months. If he installs the new equipment, it will help increase his profits as well as decrease the cost of fare which will also help the residents.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install new equipment in car

loans.name: San Paulo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Paulo se formó gracias que la señora Gladis A. se informó del programa y organizo a sus amigas para formar un comité. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa. 1. - Gladis M. invertirá en la compra de panificados, huevo, carne, mayonesa.

2. - Leonisia S. invertirá en la compra de panificados, carne, verdura.

3. - Etelvina G. invertirá en la compra de helados al por mayor para luego venderlos.

4. - Hilaria R. invertirá en la compra de golosinas, gaseosa, lácteos

5. - Cristina O. invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras al por mayor para luego venderlos.

6. - Eduvigis C. invertirá en la compra de embutidos, panificados, mayonesa, Ketchup.

7. - Bernarda A. invertirá en la compra de bebidas, lacteos, panificados, arroz, azucar, yerba.

8. - Blanca Domínguez invertirá en la compra de prendas en general.

9. - Lujan C. invertirá en la compra de carbón al por mayor para luego venderlo.

10. - Silvina D. invertirá en la compra de frutas al por mayor para luego venderlos.

11. - Gladis A. invertirá en la compra insumo para la elaboración de producto de limpieza.

12. - Gilda López invertirá en la compra de lacteo, panificados enlatados, bebidas.

13. - Basiliacia Troche invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, ect. 14. - Francisca T. invertirá en la compra de carne, panificados, embutidos, tomate lechuga.

15. - Eusebia M. invertirá en la compra de bebidas panificados, lacteos, frutas, verduras.
texts.en:
The San Paulo group was formed thanks to Ms. Gladis A. who learned about the program and organized her friends into a committee. Currently the group is composed of 15 members and they are in their first cycle of the program. 1. - Gladis M. invests in the purchase of baked goods, eggs, meat and mayonnaise.

2. - Leonisia S. invests in the purchase of baked goods, meat, vegetables

3. - Etelvina G. invests in the purchase of ice cream in bulk to sell.

4. - Hilaria R. invests in the purchase of candy, soft drinks, milk products

5. - Cristina O. invests in the purchase of fruits and vegetables in bulk

6. - Eduvigis C. invests in the purchase of cold meats, baked goods, mayonnaise, ketchup

7. - Bernarda A. invests in the purchase of drinks, milk products, baked goods, rice, sugar, tea.

8. - Blanca Domínguez invests in the purchase of clothing in general.

9. - Lujan C. invests in the purchase of coal in bulk to sell

10. - Silvina D. invests in the purchase of fruit in bulk to sell

11. - Gladis A. invests in the purchase of ingredients to make cleaning products.

12. - Gilda López invests in the purchase of milk products, baked goods, canned goods,drinks.

13. - Basiliacia Troche invests in the purchase of fabrics, yarns, etc. 14. - Francisca T. iinvests in the purchase of meat, baked goods, cold meats, tomatoes and lettuce.

15. - Eusebia M. invests in the purchase of drinks, baked goods, milk products, fruits and vegetables


Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, oil, beer, coal, baked goods, herbal medicines, pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, timber, apples, pears, tangerines, oranges, bananas, soda, dough for pies, tomatoes, lettuce, napkins , mayonnaise, mustard, etc..

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a married mom of two kids. She runs a business selling bags and purses in the local bus station. Alla is very active and energetic. She started this trade four years ago. Currently, she has about $10,000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $3,000. Most of it covers tax withholdings, vending kiosk rent and other government fees.

Alla is seeking development in business. She is hoping to keep gaining stable income from her trade so that she can help her kids get settled in life. One of her other personal goals is to purchase new pieces of furniture for her house. This time, Alla is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase her assorted merchandise. She is hoping to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Agustina P. se dedica a trabajar fuertemente para mantener a su familia y brindar las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de su pequeño hijo. Para esto ha iniciado la reconstrucción de su vivienda pero debido la ausencia del capital financiero ha detenido la obra y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción.

Una vez que el crédito sea otorgado, la señora P. logrará mejorar su vivienda dándole mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo y a la vez protegiéndose de desastres naturales que dañen la vivienda.
texts.en:
In Somotillo municipality in the city of Chinandega, Agustina P. works hard to support her family and provide the necessary conditions for the development of her little son. For this reason she has started the reconstruction of her house, but due to the lack of financing capital she has halted the work and come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase the construction materials. Once the loan is granted, P. will be able to improve her home, giving better living conditions to her son and at the same time protecting him from the natural disasters that harm the house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to improve her house

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina O. is a hard-working businesswoman. She is 37 years old and married with four children who are still in school. She trades in fresh eggs. She purchases her supply of eggs from the poultry farmers and retails them to her customers. She enjoys her trade very much but she says prices of commodities and transport cost have gone up due to the current fuel crisis and she has to travel to Kumasi to buy the eggs. Thus, her working capital is insufficient to purchase enough stock. Georgina cooks some of the eggs with pepper and sells them at the road side of Obuasi. A boiled egg with pepper is very delicious, and this is what she has done for the past six years in taking care of her family.

With this loan, Georgina plans to inject additional capital into her business to enable her meet the demands of the market. She plans to use the loan to buy increased stock of eggs, pepper, oil and firewood to increase her profit. Georgina hopes to mobilize more savings to pay for her children's educational fees. She is a member of the community group called Kingdom Trust Group through which she has health insurance. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of fresh eggs, pepper, onions, and other supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife. Ali is has been working as a furniture painter for ten years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase new painting tools and have some cash. Ali has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time.

The previous loans influenced his life in a good way. His clients are carpenters. Ali decided to do this business because of his talent in color mixing.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools and have some cash.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is 53 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband works repairing bicycles. Her oldest child is in senior high school while the rest are in primary school in the village. She manufactures palm oil and sells bananas to support her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale because she has insufficient capital to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to the palm oil business, she also sells fruits by the roadside in the community where she lives. She says this business has slowed down due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce palm oil in larger quantities. She will also use the loan to purchase bananas so that she can supply them to her customers on a regular basis. Salamatu believes this will help expand her business to earn more income, so she can support her family and finance her children's education. 

Salamatu belongs to a village bank called God will Provide.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruits and bananas to expand her business.

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. P., 44, makes a daily income by cultivating rice and some fruit out of her house, earning approximately US$ 2 per day. To help with the family's food needs, P.'s husband works on a construction site and earns around US$ 4 a day. The couple has given birth to four children who are single; two of them are students and the other are employed. The family faces a problem; they are too tired and must take a taxi to work frequently. Thus, P. is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to ride.

The other two borrowers are:

P., 54, who is a widow and a farmer; she's applying for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to sell to earn a living; and

S., 40, a widow and a farmer who is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.

The borrowers are people living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for riding

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 23-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in Southern Lebanon. Marwan has ben working as an electrician for three years. He deals mainly with houses. Marwan has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan.
Marwan is distinguished in his work because he does well. His clients are people from his region. When Marwan first strated his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He chose his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expan his business by working on bigger projects.

loans.use: Marwan will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en:
Ryad is a 28 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ryad has owned a coffee shop for four years. He also serves “narguileh” (also known as “shisha” in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and coffee machine. This is the first time that Ryad has requested a loan. 
Ryad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. Ryad decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on starting a new business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and coffee machine

loans.name: Winona

texts.en:
M. Winona is a 62 year old widow with three children. Two of them are already working. She is a businesswoman and a very hardworking mother.

She is a good and active member of Paglaum since she joined. She has no record of default payment or arriving late for their meetings.

Her business started in 1999 with a capitalization of only 2,000 Php. During the harvest period she delivers her pigs to her customers in the meat shop in the neighboring town.

Now she needs more capital to buy more pigs, vitamins and pig-feed and to maintain her business. Her business helps her so much with the needs of her family, especially since she is already a widow.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, pig-feed and vitamins

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khaled owns a jewelry shop. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase gold which he uses to make his jewelry.  This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.  Khaled's previous loans helped him to improve his work. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he faced some financiA. difficulties but he decided on doing this type of work because he likes it and has experience.  In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase gold to make jewelry.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 40, is married and lives with her five children in Phnom Penh. She is a local teacher and also sells grocery items, making around US$4 each day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Her husband makes about US$8 each day. However, they must also support an older sister and mother at home. Heng S. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase groceries in bulk so that she can have a special discount from the wholesaler. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married. She sells glasses at Angolenko market, Zaporozhye city. She has been in this business for ten years and her monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. Her kiosk is located in a good place at the market. She has many repeat clients because of great variety, excellent customer service and a flexible pricing policy.

Galina would like to obtain this loan to purchase new sunglasses for the summer season. She hopes to make additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new sunglasses for the summer season

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 35 años, es una mujer con mucha fortaleza y coraje, quedó viuda hace 6 meses y actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. La siembra y venta de diversos productos se ha convertido en la mejor actividad económica que desarrolla, tras el fallecimiento de su esposo quedó endeudada, fue entonces cuando sacó  fortaleza anímica y se propuso trabajar el doble en sus cultivos. La tierra y su esfuerzo dieron buenos frutos y pudo pagar todas sus cuentas, desde entonces se encuentra mucho más tranquila y motivada a seguir trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos que están en crecimiento y espera que de mayores la ayuden con las siembras. A Haydee le agrada cultivar y cuidar sus plantas, sobre todo las arvejas, porque cosecha tres veces de una sola siembra y esto le genera muy buenas ganancias. Sus anhelos a futuro son de incrementar su producción para comprar más terrenos de cultivo que le generen más dinero para la educación de sus hijos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, durante los periodos concluidos demostró mucha entrega y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Y en los diversos eventos que se organizan, como por ejemplo actividades deportivas; ella es quien les da el ánimo de triunfo a sus compañeros, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de todos en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arvejas de una calidad que resista el clima helado.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old and is a very strong and courageous woman. She became a widow six month ago and currently lives with her three children in her own home. After the death of her husband left her indebted, her main economic activity became planting and selling diverse products, and she had to stay strong and work doubly hard on her crops. The land and her efforts bared fruit, and she was able to pay off all of her debts. Since then she has been much more calm and motivated to keep working for the wellbeing of her children, who are still growing. She hopes the older ones can help with the planting. Haydee enjoys cultivating and caring for her plants, especially her peas, because she can harvest them three times with only one planting and that helps her generate very nice earnings. Her goal for the future is to increase her production to be able to purchase more land to cultivate, which will help her earn more money for her children's education. This is her 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has shown herself to be very responsible and dedicated to her payments. In the various events the community bank organizes, for example sporting functions, Haydee is who lifts the spirits of her companions because she has earned the esteem of all the bank's members. She plans to use the money she is requesting to invest in the purchase of two bags of pea seeds that resist frost.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Zainuramo

texts.ru: Зайнурамо Абдуллоева проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Зайнурамо более 3 лет занимается бизнесом. Она откармливает и продает скот. Муж находится на заработках в России. Кредит просит для закупа теленка, чтобы в дальнейшем продавать ее молоко.
texts.en:
Zainuramo A. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 35 years old, married and has 6 children. Zainuramo has been an entrepreneur for over 3 years. She feeds and sells livestock. Her husband works in Russia. She is requesting a loan to buy a calf, so that she can sell milk in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly O. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Merly is married and has four small children. To make a living, Merly sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Merly earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC.

Merly is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Merly from PMPC. She plans to use some of the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy F. est une femme de 55 ans, marièe et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend de fruits locaux de saison. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Amy F. is a 55 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She sells local seasonal fruits. This loan will allow her to increase her business in order to better meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Local fruit sales

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel M. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City.  Richel, 28, is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting cassava for sale.  Richel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her child and save the remainder as a reserve for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana,  préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent comme activités génératrices de revenus le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, des céréales, fruits et charbon de bois  en détail aux environs de Fana et sont revendus  sur place à  Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer non seulement les intérêts  de Soro Yiriwaso, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et aussi  réinvestir le reste dans les activités. Elles ambitionnent de diversifier leur commerce avec d’autres produits.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”, son 11 miembros que forman parte de este simpático grupo; nuestros miembros viven en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, situado a 45 minutos en auto desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con la agricultura como actividad principal, la ganadería y finalmente el comercio minorista, nuestras socias en su mayoría venden comida en el mercado central del pueblo, otras crían animales menores (cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos), para su futura venta, otras socias tiene sus tiendas de abarrotes y venta de CDs de música y de películas; nuestros socios incrementan poco a poco sus negocios haciéndolos más prósperos y más amplios, ellos se reinventan cada cierto tiempo para así ser más competitivos frente a otros negocios, solicitan el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.
