Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido y así mismo prometen seguir adelante pese a las dificultades.
texts.en:
Eleven members make up this friendly group known as the "LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS" communal bank. The members live in the Andahuaylillas district which is 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. The members alternate their different activities with their main activities which are agriculture, livestock farming and retail sales. The women in the group, for the most part, sell prepared meals in the town's central market. Some of them raise small farm animals (guinea pigs, baryard fowl, pigs) for sale. Still others have grocery stores or sell music CDs or movies. Our members little by little increase their sales making their enterprises more prosperous and of wider variety. Every so often they reinvent themselves to be more competitive with other merchants. They request this loan to invest in their various business enterprises. Our members are grateful for and greatly value the funds obtained through this method and commit to the total repayment of their debt in the time frame agreed upon and pledge to continue forward despite difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the various enterprises.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa Margarita C. D. M. resiD. en el municipio D. Ciudad Arce del departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa tiene 31 años D. edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 4 años y 18 meses D. edad. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. ropa, que la comercializa con amigos y vecinos, el deseo D. Rosa es poder montar formalmente un negocio donD. pueda ser conocida por muchos clientes, pero para esto necesita D. tu crédito, que le ayudara a consolidar su negocio y así poder crecer económicamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Margarita C. D. M. lives in the town of Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. Rosa is 31 years-old and lives with her husband and their two children, 4 years and 18 months old. Rosa works selling clothes to her friends and neighbors. Rosa wishes to be able to formally create a business in which she can attract more customers. To accomplish this goal, Rosa needs this loan, which will help her to consolidate her business and thus allow it to grow economically, helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne M. est présidente d’un groupe dénommé « La Paix Plus » composé de 29 micro entrepreneurs solidairement unis pour faire avancer leurs petits commerces aux moyens des microcrédits obtenus des prêteurs du monde par le biais de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Evelyne habite et exerce son activité dans une zone la plus montagneuse située à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Son activité consiste à livrer des pains dans son quartier et les environs. L’affaire lui génère hebdomadairement $66 de bénéfice. Evelyne est cliente fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC. Elle a déjà reçu 4 fois le prêt qu’elle a correctement remboursé. Elle compte avec le prochain crédit ouvrir un autre dépôt dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et d’augmenter le bénéfice. Son ambition est d’atteindre 5 dépôts de livraison des pains envue d’accroitre le revenu. Evelyne est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 19 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Evelyne M. is the president of a group named "La Paix Plus", which is composed of 29 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to advance their small businesses by means of micro-loans obtained from world lenders via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. Evelyne lives in the most mountainous area located west of the city of Kinshasa where she operates her business. Her business consists in delivering bread in her district and surrounding areas. It generates a weekly profit of $66 for her. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC. She has received four loans before, which she has repaid properly. With the next loan, she intends to open another outlet with the goal of meeting the needs of her customers and to increase profits. Her ambition is to achieve five delivery outlets for bread with the aim of growing her income. Evelyne is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who range from 3 to 19 years of age. Three of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an other outlet for selling bread

loans.name: Rezek

texts.en:
Rezek is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children. He first learned agriculture fifteen years ago when he started working in this sector . In 2000, he started working on his own as a farmer and he is excelling in the business.

Today, Rezek is requesting $1,200 in order to purchase agriculture equipment needed in order to enlarge his business and make more dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Charibel's Group

texts.en:
Charibel M. is from the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old. Charibel is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Charibel married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Charibel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Charibel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charibel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charibel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. Charibel is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Charibel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita P. is from the village of Sinian. She is 51 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Angelita and her husband are engaged in fishing and farming. They have been engaged in their businesses for over twenty years and earn approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Angelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Self Empowerment Group

texts.en: Self Empowerment is a group of five borrowers, led by Daniel K., living and working near Red Light, Paynesville. Red Light is Liberia's largest market, a bustling area near the capital (Monrovia) that is full of shops, stalls and vendor tables. Daniel is 37 years old and married with five children, aged 7 months to 16 years old. He also cares for two of his wife's aunt's daughters. Daniel is a high school graduate and went on to university but had to stop his studies after the first year due to a lack of money to pay school fees. Daniel’s business is selling kerosene. He buys wholesale in 55-gallon drums and then sells gallons of kerosene to his customers. Most of his customers are from rural areas and use the kerosene for lanterns and cooking. Daniel's share of this 27,000 Liberian dollar group loan is 6,000 Liberian dollars. He intends to buy more kerosene with the money from the loan. Daniel has been running his business for five years and this is his first loan from Kiva field partner LEAP. Daniel says the key to his success has been talking to customers in a good manner and sometimes he adds bonuses to their purchases to reward them. His dream is to own a gas station someday. If he makes good profits from his business, Daniel hopes to be able to educate his children as fully as possible, send his wife to school and complete his own university education. He also wants to build a house for his family. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Daniel is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for resale

loans.name: Vannurn's Group

texts.en:
The loan group, which consists of five people, is located in Prasat Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vannurn H. was selected by the members to be the group leader. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Vannurn H. is 49 years old. She sells rice in front of a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Seym Touch, is a driver who earns a small salary. To improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Vannurn H. wants to expand her business, but she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy more cooking rice to sell. She is the mother of two children. One of her children is employed in garment factory and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more cooking rice to sell

loans.name: Carlos Gerald

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce de León, el caballero Carlos M. se desempeña como maestro de primaria en un pequeño colegio del municipio con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a su hijo por medio del mejoramiento de su nivel de vida por la reconstrucción de su vivienda.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, zinc, perlines, cemento para mejoramiento de la vivienda y la elaboración de un curto para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida tanto a su cónyuge como a su hijo que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce de Leon, Carlos M. works as a primary school teacher in a small public school, in order to support his family and improve things for his child through a better life achieved by renovating his house. He is requesting a loan to purchase building materials, such as bricks, zinc, purlins, and cement, in order to improve his house and to build a room, to provide better living conditions for his wife and child, who are in great need of such improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, zinc, purlins, cement

loans.name: Abibat

texts.en:
Abibat is a hardworking and friendly woman. She is married to a civil servant and she is 30 years old with three children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy.

Abibat sells sachet water (water in plastic bags) and drinks at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for three years. She is a LAPO client and is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: The person who appears in the picture is Mrs. Chay R., 33 years of age. She lives in a commune of Phnom Penh, the city of Cambodia. Chay R. is a temporary laborer who is working at the busy local market. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband buys and sells used motors in the village for a profit. Chay R. has three kids who are teenagers, one of whom is no longer in school and works as a seamstress in the garment industry. The other two are attending school. Normally, Chay R. has received much cash from her husband’s business, which is the main source of the family’s income. She hopes to improve this investment and is asking for a loan to assist her husband to upgrade the financial capital for his motor sale trade.

loans.use: To upgrade the financial capital for his motor sale trade.

loans.name: Los Lirios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Liririos II está conforman Amparo R., Susana P. y Gertrudes S. tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace tiempo. La coordinadora del grupo es Amparo R. de 27 años quien inicio hace tres años con el comercio de perecederos. En aquel entonces era poco lo que comercializaba actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo bien surtido.
R. pronto dará a luz a su tercer hijo el cual espera con emoción junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos de siete y cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Group Liririos II is made up of Amparo R., Susana P. y Gertrudes S. three hard working women that sell fruits and vegetables, they all have many years of experience. The coordinator of the group is Amparo R. who is 27 years old, she began three years ago in the business of selling perishables, at that time there was little to sell now she has a small, well stocked cart. She will soon give birth to her third child, which she awaits excitedly to have join she and her husband and their two children of seven and four years old.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Talubangi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through a motorcycle operator venture, buying and selling charcoal and rice and her net-working business.

Lolita’s 49-year-old husband, Ramon, is a tricycle driver, and they have 3 children who are between 20-24 years old. One child is currently going to school and also helps out in the business as part of the daily chores while the other 2 children have work that helps the family.

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her motorcycle operator venture, buying and selling charcoal and rice and a net-working business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Lolita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund the operations of her charcoal and rice sales business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 19th loan, the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use on her motorcycle operator venture, etc. Lolita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance and additional working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Ramon L., an assistant manager, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own salon for quite some time now.

Elizabeth has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her salon business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 44,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying equipment and expanding her salon business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for education for her children.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying equipment and expanding her salon business.

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar M. is from the village of Hovouny in the Shirak Marz in the Republic of Armenia. She is the proud mother of two daughters and one son. Paytsar had a secondary school education with additional training as a medical nurse. In addition to running her small agriculture business she provides her extended family in Gyumri with vegetables. Her main business activity is raising cattle and growing potatoes. Paytsar has been engaged in agricultural activities for 23 years and considers herself a hard working entrepreneur.

With this loan Paytzar is planning to expand her business. She will purchase additional calves, fertilizers and potato seeds. If all goes as planned, Paytsar will be able to increase her family income by 30%.

Paytsar was born in Hoyouny, educated there and lived there her entire life. According to Paytsar the nature of Hoyouny is particularly beautiful. Her hopes for the future are to see her daughter and son graduate from college. Her daughter currently attends medical college and her son will be graduating this fall. Through Paytsar’s business proceeds she has been able to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy calves, fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: José Bacilio

texts.es: José Bacilio A. A. de 60 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales trabajan y  en ocasiones ayudan a su padre. José es un señor muy trabajador, el cual se dedica de lleno a su trabajo con el deseo de brindarle una vida mejor a su familia, desde hace 30 años que se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, en lo cual cuenta con una basta experiencia y muchos clientes. Así mismo él posee una venta de ladrillos, en la se encarga de elaborarlos, así mismo hace tejas, las cuales se utilizan para poner en los techos, en este negocio posee 10 años de experiencia, pero debido a que José cuenta con muy buenas referencias por ser una persona muy responsable con sus clientes ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar cemento por mayor, así mismo comprar todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de dicho trabajo, en el cual quiere entrar de lleno.
texts.en:
José Bacilio A. A., age 60, lives in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and two minor children. The children sometimes work and help their father. José is a very hard-working man. He is fully committed to his work in the hope of giving his family a better life. He has been farming for 30 years. He has plenty of experience and a lot of customers. Additionally, he has a business making and selling bricks. He also makes tiles, which are used on roofs. He has ten years of experience in this business. Because José has very good references for being a very responsible person with his customers, his business has been slowly growing. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy cement wholesale. He will also buy all of the tools that are necessary to make bricks and tiles. He wants to fully concentrate on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and raw material to make bricks and tiles

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Reina M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, tiene una pequeña pulperia el cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “REINA” misma que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación
Doña Reina cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, en su negocio tiene una gran variedad de producto para la venta especialmente lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Café, pollo, maseca, manteca, huevos etc.
Doña Reina esta casada con el señor Wilmer Girón el cual es policía, de ellos dependen 3 personas.
las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las necesita para pagar la crianza y gastos escolares de sus hijos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina M. is a merchant, and her main activity is selling groceries. She has a small grocery store, which operates under the name of Reina Grocery Store. It is located in her house. Reina has five years of experience in this type of business. It is notable that during this time she has known how to manage the business. There is a great variety of products for sale in her business. She especially carries products that are most needed for daily consumption like sugar, rice, coffee, chicken, cornmeal, shortening, and eggs, etc. Reina is married to Wilmer Girón, a policeman. They have three dependents. They need the earnings they get from the business to pay for raising their children and the children’s educational expenses. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise wholesale in order to get greater earnings. They need the earnings to give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal, powdered milk, soup, noodles, toilet paper, medicines,toothe paste, shortening, oil, and sanitary napkins

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Kol R., age 41, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs and crops. Since 1984, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband who works in construction. She is married with five kids who are going to school and also work. In order to earn extra income, Kol R. will be using the loan to buy more piglets and crop seeds to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and crop seeds to raise.

loans.name: Gordiano

texts.en:
Hard working B. Gordiano has, over years, been operating a cattle fattening farm in Mpundo, Ibanda. He sells cows to earn a living, from the periodic markets that take place around the area in western Uganda. In this business he directly purchases the livestock and then raises them for some time on his farm. When the livestock is ready for market, he supplies to butchers, hotels and other customers in the periodic market. 

His main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable price on the market and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going for over 10 years. In a month, he makes profits in the neighborhood of 250,000 Ugandan shillings. 

His future plans are to fully expand the transactions and to do farm restocking, which will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s education requirements. With this loan, he anticipates great strides in achieving this dream and restocking more cattle heads for sale.

loans.use: Towards purchase of more cattle and farm restocking.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo A. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 58 years old and is widowed with six school-aged children. Danilo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cellphone accessories and electronic products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Danilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino M. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. He is 53 years old. Avelino is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Avelino owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Avelino has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Avelino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Avelino is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Avelino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Floriano Bungano

texts.pt:
Floriano Bungano V. nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, Província de mesmo, sul de Moçambique, casada. Fez somente 3ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo na companhia do seu esposo, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (temperos, caldos, arroz, farinha, plásticos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para melhorar ainda mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Floriano Bungano V. was born in the city of Inhambane, province of the same name, in the south of Mozambique.  She is married.  She only finished third grade and did not continue due to her parents' financial conditions.  She lives in her own house with her family and has no other dependents.

She left Inhambane for Maputo in the company of her husband in search of better living conditions.  She has had her own business for more than 20 years and manages to bring in an income of about 4,000 MT per month, which she uses for household expenses and still manages to set some aside in her bank account.

She has never had a loan in another bank.  She got to know about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients of this institution.  This is her first loan — at a value of 10,000 MT — with which she intends to purchase products (seasonings, soups, rice, flour, plastic ware, and other items) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

She is confident that she will repay without any problem and will ask for a new loan to improve her business even further.

loans.use: purchase of products (seasonings, soups, rice, flour, plastic ware, and other items)

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena tiene 51 años,  por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de artesanías, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Maria nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le ha brindado su familia cuenta con este medio para realzar las compras de sus productos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica A su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is 51 years of age and her business is selling traditional handicrafts since she wished to increase the sales of her products. Above all she wishes to diversify and not sell only one product. María tells us that, thanks to the effort and support her family has always given her, she has this means of enhancing the sales of her products. 

Currently she is seeking this financing in order to purchase basic materials. Her abiding dream is to have a large store located within a marketplace that would bring economic security to her mother and her family in general.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sidet

texts.en:
Miss Sidet D. (pictured with her mother) is an 18-year-old, single woman. She lives with her mother, who is a widow, and siblings (brothers and sisters) along the Tonle Bassac River. The Tonle Bassac River is a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sidet has been a garment factory worker for two years. She is in the process of building a house, but she is not able to complete the house due to a lack of money. As a result, Sidet is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to make the finishing touches on the house.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Maryory Juana

texts.es:
Maryory de 40 años, da los servicios de expreso a niños de una escuela. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Comenzó a dar sus servicios como expreso desde que observo que por donde vive hay muchos niños que no tiene un transporte para llegar a sus escuelas. La otra motivación que tuvo para continuar con su trabajo es que es madre soltera y tiene dos niños que están estudiando la escuela. Su trabajo lo realiza recogiendo niños desde las 07h20 y los lleva a la escuela en la tarde a las 12h05 lo recoge para llevarlos a su casa. A cada niño le coba mensual $ 30.00. 

Para darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos ella quiere construir mejor su casa comprando con el préstamo cemento, arena y bloques para readecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehículo grande para lleva a más niños.
texts.en:
Maryory is 40 years old.  She provides a service driving children to school.  She lives with her two children in an urban area called Orquídeas (Orchids).  The area is so called because when it was discovered they found many flowers there and currently there is an park of orchids there.

Maryory started providing her transport services when she observed that where she lives there are many children who don't have transportation to take them to school.  The other motive that she had to continue with her work is that she is a single mother and has two children who are in school.  She picks children up at 7.20 in the morning and takes them to school.  At 12.05 she collects them and takes them home.  She receives $30 a month for each child.

To provide her two children with a better life she would like to improve her house, using her loan to buy cement, sand and blocks in order to remodel it.  In the future she would like to buy a bigger vehicle to carry more children.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Glory Fe

texts.en:
Glory Fe is from the village of Taguima, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises crops . She has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 a month from this activity.

In May 19, 2006, Glory Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and as well as to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fertilizers and farm supplies. Glory Fe is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To Purchase Additional Fertilizers and Farm Supplies

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra B. is a married woman who has two children who are five and sixteen years old. Her husband, Virginito B., is 35 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They live in Sitio Mahayahay within Barangay Daanlungsod, a part of Medellin municipality in the province of Cebu in the central Visayas islands.

Pedra is a fisherwoman who sells her catch herself. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Pedra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, thus lifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her fifth loan cycle she is borrowing 13,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more fishing tackle so that she can continue to save up for the future and business expansion. Pedra B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tackle

loans.name: Darwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Darwin Oswaldo A. P. tiene 26 años, Es soltero, vive con los padres   en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos.  No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Darwin Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Darwin Oswaldo A. P. is 26 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the canton Ventanas in the province of Rios. He doesn't have any children.

The members of the VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE (New Horizon communal bank) are located in the recinto Cachel y Grande, which belongs to the canton Ventanas. This communal bank is involved with short cycle agricultural work such as sowing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. This work requires a lot of time to do.

Darwin Oswaldo is a farmer and he sows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products in Agro Karlyta and sells his produce in the Ventanas market.

He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers in order to farm corn, rice and pigeon peas. The support of the loan will help him meet his needs financially. He is faced with challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases, and the variations in the climate. His dream is to have his own business. He likes sports.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 30 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mari, de 26 años, y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Desde muy joven Wilmer se dedicó al cultivo de café, plátano y cacao, ya que esta es la actividad que ha realizado su familia desde hace mucha generaciones. Sus productos los vende a los compradores que llegan hasta sus chacras, quienes posteriormente llevan el producto a vender a la ciudad de Lima.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar su producción.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Wilmer con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 30 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 26 year-old Mari, and his 4 children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Wilmer has been growing coffee, bananas and cacao since he was very young.  His family has been in this business for many generations.  He sells his products to buyers who come to his farm and then take his products to the city of Lima to sell.  What Wilmer most likes about his work is cultivating his land and he does this with a lot of care.  He has been in this business for 14 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his crops.  Over time, he would like to buy more land so that he can increase his production.

This is Wilmer's second loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his repayments on time and he is ready to do this.  He is a very respectful member of his community bank.  Wilmer will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers for his land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Chaka T. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec sa mère et leurs frères au quartier Pelengana village de la commune de Pelengana (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté pour des raisons sociales, (analphabétisme des parents surtout très versé dans l’islam). Il commença le petit commerce auprès d’un ami qui tenait une boutique de quincaillerie au quartier Pelengana près de la gare routière. 
Après 6 années d’expériences auprès de ce dernier, il évolua seul maintenant en menant le commerce de céréales (mil, riz, etc.) et de potasses, depuis 4 ans. Il jouit d’une grande clientèle, sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son article.    
Dans le but de satisfaire sa demande clientèle, il rentre en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er prêt, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter 2.200 kg de riz. Il s’approvisionne dans la zone office du Niger auprès des producteurs. 
Monsieur Chaka T. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et  contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. 
Son ambition est de développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Chaka T. is 33 years old, married and father to one child. He lives in a traditional family with his mother and brothers in the Pelengana village district of the municipality of Pelengana(the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

He did not attend school for social reasons (illiteracy of his parents who were very committed to their islam religion) and began trading on a small scale with a friend who had a hardware store in the Pelengana district close to the bus station. After six years working with his friend he began four years ago to develop his own business, trading in cereals (millet, rice, etc.) and potashes. He enjoys a large customer base and his sales strength is the quality of his products. 

With the aim of satisfying customer demand he has entered into a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first loan which he is planning to use to buy 2,200 kg of rice. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in the area surrounding the office area of Niger.

Mr. Chaka T. sells for cash and credit to a customer base made up of men and women. He is expecting to make a monthly profit of 60,000FCFA which will be used to repay his loan and contribute to family expenses. His ambition is to build up his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Khot K. is an  older mother blessed with six children, all of whom are single. To help the family, two of her children are working in Malay. Khot K. raises many pigs and rice crops on her own land next to her house inKompong Tom province. She receives help from her husband in this business operation.

 Because the pig raising business is a very profitable one for Khot K. and her family, Khot K. has requested a loan in order to buy additional piglets to raise to sell during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for children's parties

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 21 سنة ليس متزوج يعمل في بيع الخبز و (المناقيش) له في عمله 9 سنوات يحب عمله ويريد الى تطوير العمل يحب ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يبني عائلة له تكون اساسها متين وتطوير نفسه اجتماعية وماديا يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء قطاعة للمخبز + زيادة البضائع يتميز بالانفراد في العمل في منطقته فهو متميز ودقيق في العمل
texts.en: Hussein is 21 years old, married and works in a bakery. He has nine years experience in this. He loves what he does and wants to develop his business. He would like to be independent and start a family on a secure and solid foundation. He wants to progress and develop on a social and financial level. With this loan he wants to purchase a cutter for his bakery as well as more raw materials. His work is unique in his local area and he pays excellent attention to detail in his work.

loans.use: to purchase a cutter and raw materials for bakery

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto O. F., sueña con tener su propio negocio y para ello ya está dando sus primeros pasos, pues actualmente aunque trabaja en una carpintería los fines de semana aprovechando sus conocimientos realiza trabajaos independientemente con el fin de independizarse totalmente con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Edilberto necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas máquinas que actualmente necesita y así aumentar su capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Edilberto O. F. dreams of owning his own business and so he is taking his first steps.  Although he currently works in a carpenter's workshop, on weekends he takes advantage of his knowledge and does independent jobs so that he can eventually start working for himself.  In this way, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Edilberto needs a loan to buy some machines that he currently needs, so that he can increase his production capacity.

loans.use: to buy machinery

loans.name: Mrs. Hai Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes, all with the common aim of improving their families’ standard of living. Mrs. Hai has been selected B. the other members as the village bank president. She is a widow and has two children who are laborers. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, some of which she sells, and some of which she uses to support her family.  In addition to farming, she also weaves silk cloth. She has a problem with her field because her soil is infertile. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Hai is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 12 and 1, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife looks after the baby at the moment. Until 2008, Batbayar worked in a textile factory, but he left due to job cuts. Since then, he has been running a taxi business using the family car, and it is his family's only source of income. Since the birth of their second child, the family’s finances have become tight. Batbayar's wife used to run a clothing retail business before the birth, and now she is planning to restore her business. Luckily, Batbayar’s parents have agreed to look after the baby during the day. Mr. Batbayar is asking for a loan to buy the clothes necessary to reopen his wife’s clothes-selling business.

loans.use: to build up a stock of clothing in order to restore his wife’s clothes-selling business

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil F. is from the village of Libertad. He is 35 years old. Ramil is married and has five school-aged children. Ramil has a general store that from sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Ramil has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Ramil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Ramil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ramil is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods like soft drinks, canned goods, and noodles. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ramil from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy goods like soft drinks, canned items, and noodles

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is from the village of Frankfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 23 years old. Remedios is single and has one small child. To make a living, Remedios runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. This will be Remedios' first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old and married with three school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines.

Wilfredo grows corn and has been doing so for ten years. He earns about 25,000 PHP per harvest season.

Wilfredo is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seeds for his farm. In the future, Wilfredo hopes that his farm’s production will improve to increase his support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for his farm

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, es ganadero, vive con su esposa solamente, porque sus hijos ya están en sus respectivos hogares, él tiene más de 30 años de estar trabajando en la ganadería, ya que su padre desde muy joven le enseño a trabajar, inicia sus labores a las 4:00am hasta las 4:00pm, además de que también presta servicio de viajes de pasajeros.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado y también insumos para cultivar maíz,  como abono y fertilizantes, con esta inversión tendrá mejor hato ganadero, y al mismo tiempo su cosecha de granos básicos.
El sueño de Manuel es trabajar cada día mejor luchando contra las adversidades para lograr sobrevivir con su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel is a rancher.  He lives alone with his wife as his children already live in their own households.  Manuel has been working in ranching for more than 30 years as his father taught him to work when he was very young.  He starts his work at 4.00am and keeps going until 4.00pm.  He also provides a passenger transport service.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to buy cattle and also supplies for growing corn such as manure and fertilizers.  With this investment, he will have a better herd of cattle and a better harvest of basic grains.

Manuel's dream is to work better every day, fighting against setbacks so that he and his wife manage to survive.

loans.use: to buy cattle and also supplies for growing corn such as manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. She has been raising hogs for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

Cayetana works hard to improve her business. She said that despite hindrances like her arthritis, she supports her husband in providing for their household needs and sending their children to school.

Cayetana hopes for her family to be healthy and happy always. She also wishes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Doña Hazel comerciante de ropa usada y alquiler de cuarto, tiene tres años de haber establecido su negocio, el cual inicio con su liquidacion, ya que por muchos años, laboro como conserje.
Hoy en dia su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda en donde ha venido mejorando la infraestructura atraves de la ganancias. Con este financiamiento  hara cambio de techo al poner perlines ya que es de madera y cambiar laminas de zinc ya que algunas estan en mal estado, dando mejor refuerzo al techo y seguridad a su familia. esta contenta ya que con el credito anterior logro el aumento de la inversion y ahora la mejora de su casa que solo atravez de Afodenic se le hizo posible.
texts.en:
Ms. Hazel is a trader of used clothing and rents out a room.  She has had an established business for three years, which started with its liquidation and for many years she worked as a janitor.

Currently her goal is to improve her housing where through her profits she has come to improve the infrastructure.  With this financing she will change the roof and put purlines and replace the wood with zinc sheets since many are in poor condition, giving better reinforcement to the roof and security to her family.

She is happy because with the previous loan she achieved increased investment and now she is improving her house all because of Afodenic was made it possible for her.

loans.use: To buy purlines, zinc metal sheets, screws, and welding to change the roof.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 36 years old. She is a business lady married to William. They are blessed with three children. She has been a butcher for five years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support the family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to purchase goats, sheep and cattle for slaughtering. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children, buy a piece of land and build lodging houses. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting goats to the market and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase goats, sheep and cattle

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Denia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins.

Denia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her coffee shop and food vending businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Quintanilla Camacho

texts.es: EL Sr. F. es soltero, no tiene hijos; se dedica a prestar el servicio de alquiler de equipo de sonido para eventos sociales en su localidad, trabaja todos los fines de semana ganando S/. 250 nuevos soles semanales; él tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de parlantes para potenciar su equipo de sonido; su sueño es tener algún día su casa propia y crecer día a día en su negocio.
texts.en: Mr F. is single. He has no children. He rents out sound equipment for social events in the area. He works every weekend and earns 250 nuevos soles (PEN) a week. He is eager to get ahead. He is going to invest the loan that has been granted him in a pair of speakers to enhance the sound of his sound system. His dream is to one day own his own house and grow his business every day.

loans.use: to buy speakers to enhance the sound of his sound equipment.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Luisa is one of the members of the “Genesis”. The members are micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts and bread. Some members also have businesses such as a beauty salon or a grocery store. The businesses are located mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Luisa makes her home in a simple structure with her two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children and educate them, even while she is working and taking income home. They are attending school while she is walking around in different communities to sell her products. She enjoys being at her home. She sells miscellaneous products like clothes, underwear and cosmetics.

Luisa is very excited about receiving her 4th loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous three loans satisfactorily and taking an important step toward her business’s growth. She will use this new loan to buy pants, T-shirts, skirts, blouses and shirts. She will use the profits to cover her family expenses and to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

In this loan, we are adding two pictures to complete a picture with most of the 25 members since it was impossible to get a photo that captured everyone.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 51-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. In 2005, he started selling a wide range of Lebanese food products such as bread in order to support his family. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products to sell. He will also perform the needed maintenance on his car to facilitate products delivery throughout towns and villages. This will be his second Kiva loan. It’s positive to learn that he has indeed increased his sales and income since taking the first loan. In the future, Ahmad plans to open his own grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and perform needed maintenance on his car to facilitate product delivery.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman and blessed with six children. For the past 5 years, she has been practicing farming to make a living. She also practices dairy farming. Nancy has employed three people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizer

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 39 years old, has a common law husband, and has five children, four of whom attend school. Cathy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has bee doing for five years. 

Cathy is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to bU. feeds and vitamins for the pigs.  This is Cathy's fifth loan from NWTF.

In the future, Cathy would like to expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy, de 30 años es un hombre responsable y alegre. A pesar de los constantes problemas que afrontó, no se desanima. Al contrario lucha por salir adelante, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huaycha. Hace un año murió su madre, que fue su única compañera. A pesar de ello continúa trabajando sin descanso, pues desea salir adelante y lograr sus objetivos. Hace 4 años que comenzó a sembrar papa, maíz y pasto en sus 4 parcelas de terreno productivo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es tener que tomar decisiones sabias e importantes, como cuando la plaga llega a malograr sus cultivos, necesita curar y limpiar sus cultivos durante todo el día. ”Eso lo aprendí de mi madre”, comenta. Además ya es conocido entre los comerciantes de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende sus cosechas. Pero como es un hombre responsable y con muchas ambiciones. También se dedica a la crianza de vacas, ya tiene 3 de buena calidad y espera incrementar su ganado, pues quiere dedicarse a la elaboración de productos lácteos en cantidad. Asimismo se dedica a la construcción de casas como albañil, así obtiene un dinero extra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Miguel” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues en su asociación la responsabilidad es importante. Percy de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para esparcirlo en su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad “amarilla y blanca”.
texts.en:
30-year-old Percy is a responsible and cheerful man.  In spite of the constant problems he has faced, he has not been discouraged.  On the contrary, he works hard to get ahead in life.  He lives in his own home which is located in the town of Huaycha.  One year ago his mother, who was his only companion, died.  In spite of this, he continues working without rest as he would like to get ahead and achieve his goals.  He started sowing potatoes, corn and fodder on his four plots of farmland four years ago.  What he most enjoys about his work is having to take wise and important decisions such as when pests ruin his crops and he needs to care for and clean his crops all day long. "I learned this from my mother", he comments.  In addition, Percy is well known among the traders in the city of Huancayo where he sells his harvests.  He is a responsible man with many ambitions and he also raises cows.  He has three good-quality cows and he hopes to increase the size of his herd as he would like to start producing dairy products in bulk.  At the same time, he also works as a builder, building houses which makes him extra money.

Percy is a member of the 'San Miguel' community bank and this is his seventh loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you so that he can achieve his goals.  For his part, Percy pledges to be punctual in making his loan repayments as, in his association, responsibility is important.  With your support, Percy will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over the next lot of 'amarilla' (yellow) and 'blanca' (white) potatoes he sows.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
This is Noime, 41, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rufo, her business partner, and a mother to her six children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Noime operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Noime hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur is a 22-year-old, young and enthusiastic man. He has been breeding cattle for the past 5 years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his young wife in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Seymur usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them, and resells at a more profitable price. His monthly income is 250 AZN. Seymur and his wife have overcome obstacles and they need more capital to improve their living conditions. Seymur has applied for 600 AZN to purchase two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui vend devant son domicile des produits agricoles tels que l'arachide,le haricot...Elle exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et arrive à obtenir des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les besoins de ses 4 enfants notamment sur le plan alimentaire, sanitaire et de la scolarité. Elle sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter des produits agricoles et élargir ainsi son fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mbène is a married woman who sells farm products (such as peanuts and beans) in front of her home. She's been running this business for three years, and manages to turn enough profits to provide for herself and her four children, in particular with respects to food, healthcare and schooling.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 in order to buy farm products and bolster her stock. Her ambition is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy farm products (such as peanuts and beans)

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria, quiere aprovechar la temporada de fin de año, ya que en este tiempo las ventas aumentan esto le ha llevado a solicitar nuevamente prestamo, adquiriendo camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, para damas y caballeros, ya que la demanda aumenta quiere estar preparada para que sus ventas sean mejor. Para Candelaria los préstamos anteriores han mejorado su inventario y han ayudado a crecer como comerciante, aunque ha cancelado sus ultimos pagos con un pequeño retraso, esto no le permite aparecer por el momento con un segundo prestamo republicado.
texts.en: Candelaria wants to take advantage of the end of year season because that’s the time when sales increase.  This has led her to request a loan once again to buy shirts, pants and underwear for women and men since demand increases and she wants to be prepared so that her sales will be good.  For Candelaria, the previous loans have improved her inventory and have helped her to grow as a merchant.  Because she had a small delay in making her previous payments, this does not allow her to appear at the moment with a second republished loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Eugenia esta casada con  el señor Jorge y viven la ciudad de La Paz tienen  dos hijos que están en la edad  escolar, la cliente vende comida  y su esposo trabaja  en la   en una empresa publica,  juntos trabajan sacrificadamente  para salir adelante   y de esta manera lograr sus objetivos que tienen en la familia el crédito  que solicito lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de la casa donde viven ya que se acerca la época de lluvia y desea pronto refaccionar su casa, la Sra. Eugenia se siente feliz por ser beneficiado con el crédito, ya que con este crédito la  Sra. brindara mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married to Jorge, and they live in the city of La Paz. They have two school-age children.

Eugenia sells food, and her husband works for a public agency. They both work hard and make sacrifices to get ahead and to achieve the family's goals.

She will use the loan she asked for to buy construction materials for repairs on their house because the rainy season is coming and she wants to make the repairs quickly. Eugenia is happy to have the loan because she can use it to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Fuente De Amor 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marie is one of the members of the “Fuente de amor” (Source of love) 1, 2 & 3 group which has 15 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Marie lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. This group, where more than 50% are Haitian, moved to this town pursuing a prosperous life by working in the sugarcane industry. 

Marie is very excited to receive her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business growth. She has had her business for about three and a half years; she started it with a loan she took. She is running a clothing sales business, and she is planning on investing the new loan in clothes like pants, blouses, shirts, and shoes for women and men, etc. She sells them by walking around and from her house.

Marie’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their five children; three of them live in her house. She tells us that her greatest dream is to have her own house. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to save because she wants to make her dream come true, the one to own a house to share with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has five children. Aba is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells in Abuenu are cosmetics, sandals, and ladies clothing. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics, sandals, and ladies clothing for sale. With the new profits from her business, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, sandals, and ladies clothing for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James was born in Kaya village, Siaya County. In western Kenya. He is married with children and is engaged in retail small scale business. James wants to make a difference in his community and town of Siaya by engaging community health outreach programme run by a Community Based Organization CBO in the district. He has also committed to spend most of his free time with the CHW counseling the youth on avoiding anti social practices, drug abuse and AIDs/HIV prevention. James is happy to own his own motorcycle and is ready to give back to the community the free tranport services to CHW.  James will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family, he plans to buy another motorcycle and support more CHWs and other community work in future.

loans.use: To Purchase a Motorcycle to Support Community Health Workers and for Micro-Business

loans.name: Felipe Ignacio

texts.en:
Felipe is 21 years old and his dream is to become a nurse. 

He is the younger brother of a family of three siblings.He is an excellent student who studied under scholarship at school because her family has very limited resources. His father works in the kitchen at a restaurant and his mother was a housekeeper who unfortunately is currently unemployed. He is the first in his family to attend college, and managed to do so with the help of his mother and state loans to finance the first two years of his career.

For him to finish a career in nursing is very important. Not only to financially help his family and have a better future, but also because he believes that public health can help improve the quality of life of people.
Felipe needs a loan to pay for tuition to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: Helps Felipe to pay for his education

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa runs a small store where she sells snacks and other groceries. She is asking for a loan in order to buy her products at wholesale quantities. Currently she cannot buy in large amounts and she sees her profits suffer. Her home is located in a very rough sector of Guayaquil. She lives up a dirt hill which makes it very difficult to transport groceries and merchandise, especially in the rainy season when the hill is muddy. Part of her business is made of cement but she aspires to make many more improvements to her home. She and her husband have three kids and their goal is to provide them with a good education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy her merchandise at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Asuisui

texts.en: Taro in coconut cream is one of people's old time favorites. Asuisui sells this as well as Samoan cocoa  or niu to go along with it, depending on the buyer’s choice.  Three people work for Asuisui.  Her weekends are used to prepare the necessary ingredients for the stall like getting taro from the plantations, husking nuts and so on.  After all debts have been paid for she makes a profit $300.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of taro, bananas, coconuts and yams. The loan will also purchase wood, a gas stove as well as finance school fees and home improvement.

loans.name: Violet Atyang

texts.en: Violet is married with two children who are both in primary school.  She is a primary school dropout and has not undertaken any formal training. Her husband is not employed. She started her business in 2002 in order to support her family.  She gets her stock from bigger towns adjacent to Lake Victoria, such as Sio Port and Funyula, and sells it to the locals at a higher price.  With a loan from PEMCI, Violet wishes to increase her stock.  Through her business, she has been able to support her family and bring services closer to the consumers.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Ezounougan

texts.fr:
Ezounougan A. is a local merchant. He was born in 1933 and has 15 family members to support. A brave man, he started a grocery business 20 years ago, and thus, he is able to provide for his family despite his advanced years. His ability to manage his revenues allows him to maintain steady sales. However, most of his revenues go towards daily household needs, and he is encountering difficulties reinvesting in the expansion of his display of goods. Having demonstrated his management abilities, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to revitalize his shop. Increasing his sales will allow him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Ezounougan est un commerçant dans sa localité. Né en 1933, il prend en charge une famille de quinze (15) personnes. Brave, Monsieur A. a commencé ce commerce d'alimentation générale et divers il y a 20 ans et c'est grâce à cela qu'il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille malgré son âge avancé. Sa capacité de gestion de ses revenus lui permet de maintenir une certaine constance de chiffre d'affaire. Toutefois, une grande partie de ses revenus étant consommées par les besoins quotidiens du ménage, il rencontre des difficultés de reinvestissement pour agrandir son étallage. Ayant démontré également sa capacité de gestion de Il sollicite un crédit de $1200 afin de ravitallier sa boutique en marchandises. L'augmentation de son chiffre d'affaire lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in general food items

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
R. Erkin has been engaged in business for 7 years. She has 3 children. Her business is trade of office supplies and is located in Gafurov, Khujand, in the Farovon market. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. She is a responsible person and repays her loan on time.

She has a wide assortment of office supplies, and her business is going well. Presently it is school season, and she has good turnover of her stock. She buys her goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. She goes to purchase goods every week. In the future she wants to increase the volume of her goods. For this reason, she is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Sra. Guillermina is married to Sr. Ramon Benitez and they have one 9-year old daughter who is in a local school. Guillermina works as a house cleaner in the mornings and as a street vendor in the afternoon, selling sneakers in different neighborhoods of the city. Guillermina is a dynamic, enterprising young woman. She has a vehicle, bought on consignment, to augment her business and allow her to offer more merchandise.
