Kennedy A. is 34 years old and the father of four children. He is married to Eveline Atieno and they live in Rongo, an upcoming town in Migori County.

Kennedy operates an open-air retail shop where he sells household items like detergents, basic electrical appliances and a few beauty products. He has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He is taking out his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying his first loan without default. 

Kennedy will use his loan to buy a stock of household items to sell. He will use his anticipated profits to pay back his loan and also to feed his family. His dreams and desires are to expand and open a retail shop in a permanent spot as opposed to his open-air location. He is hoping that Kiva lenders will help make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas, beef, cassava and rice

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is 38 years old. Her husband’s name is A. A. and he operates a clothes-selling business. His shop is located in the bazaar from where he sells a variety of women's and men's clothes, etc. He offers competitive prices to customers who buy clothes from him regularly. He also does a second business which is construction supplies. He fulfills the requirements for construction supplies of his customers and supplements the household income.  
Kousar supports her husband in his clothes-selling business. She has a good number of customers in neighboring areas. She fills their orders and earns extra income. 

She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her two elder sons sell salt packs to different departmental stores and others are studying in a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy clothes for the expansion of his clothes-selling business. This will help him offer more variety to his customers and earn better profit. He has been operating this business for the past 3 years and Kousar is very much hopeful that it will further improve after the loan investment. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her 1st loan application to Asasah.  She belongs to Kasur which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Jamatpura.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Eseza has a business of a food stand. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. She also rents out homes as an additional source of income.

Eseza has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more  bunches of bananas and vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and onions. The main business challenge for Eseza is thieves. 

Eseza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, boxes of tomatoes, onions, eggplants and cabbages

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who have selected Mrs. Sophy to be the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can increase their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Sophy was born in 1973. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries in order to earn some profit to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Sophy is applying for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Yorn, is a palm juice collector and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he can grow rice, to not sell, to support his family. She is a mother of ten children, one of whom is an iron welder, while the other two are helping her to sell groceries, the other three are studying in local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Wilhelmina E., 49, does just that. Wilhelmina is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT*. She is married to a driver, Jaime, and mothers her three children who are still studying now. Together, they live in Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezno City, Philippines.

Wilhelmina runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in the extension of their house. Everyday she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they deserve. Monthly, Wilhelmina earns Php11,000 on average.

To help her continue operation of her business she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She intends to meet the demands of her customers. As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items. 

Wilhelmina acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store to grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man and the father of four school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a freelance bread distributor since 2000. He delivers tasty Lebanese breads to people from his town and its neighboring villages. This will be his second Kiva loan. He notes that he has indeed increased his business productivity and income since taking the first loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $ 2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new van in order to continue expansion of his business and deliver his products on a wider range.  His income is important to help support his wife and four children.

loans.use: to purchase a new van.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 32 years old.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Marilou is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more canned goods, beverages & snack foods to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy  more inventory for her store

loans.name: Florajaida

texts.en:
Florajaida, 69 years old, is from Labo Ozamiz City. She is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Florajaida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community.  Florajaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Florajaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florajaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Florajaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles and spices for her store. This loan will be her tenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles and spices to sell in the store.

loans.name: Adjenia Group

texts.fr: ADJENIA est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité, ce groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. La présidente du groupe, Zénabou Titilayo (celle qui n'a pas de document en main), est née le 22 Décembre 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Razak. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Zénabou Titilayo et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Il y a près de dix ans que Zénabou Titilayo mène comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques et de sous-vêtements de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Zénabou Titilayo fait ses achats au Togo et au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Zénabou Titilayo sollicite un crédit avec le second membre du groupe ADJENIA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Adjenia is a group of two people who live in the same district in Benin. With the aim of strengthening their business, this group is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The president of the group, Zénabou Titlayo (the woman who is not holding a document in the photo) was born on 22nd December 1973 in Benin and is married to a tailor by the name of Razak. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Zénabou Titlayo and her husband live with their children. For almost ten years Zénabou Titilayo has been selling cosmetics and underwear on a door-to-door basis; this allows her to provide for her own needs as well as those of her family. She buys her products in Togo and in Benin. In order to satisfy customer demand she is requesting a loan with the second member of the Adjenia group. This loan will allow her to satisfy customer demand more readily and to make more money.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Ema Peregrina

texts.en:
Ema Peregrina is a married woman with six children. She is 54 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 30 years.

Ema Peregrina sells items like soft drinks and canned goods to the people in her community. She also provides mobile phone prepaid loads. She is also a Personal Collection (a direct sales company) dealer. She sells items like lotion, shampoo and fabric conditioner. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month from the store and selling Personal Collection products.

Ema Peregrina is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy prepaid load credits and more items to sell such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy prepaid load credits, soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Mirian Encarnacion

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian se dedica  a la elaboración D. repostería, realiza panes, galletas queques y tortas, quien debe despertar a muy tempranas horas para poder realizar la elaboración D. su masa para pan y empanadas, tiene una experiencia D. 12 años aproximadamente, necesita el dinero para poder comprar un horno ya que el que tiene se encuentra muy usado, es una persona que tiene ya muchos clientes, entregas sus productos a las distintas zonas y también tiene un puesto donD. pone a la ventas sus riquísimas empanadas, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian works in a pastry shop where she makes bread, cookies, muffins, and cakes. She wakes up in the early morning hours so that she can make the dough used for bread and empanadas. Mirian has approximately 12 years of experience.

She needs money so that she can buy an oven since the one she currently has is heavily used. Mirian already has many customers. She delivers her products to different areas and also has a vending post where she sells her delicious empanadas. Mirian is a hardworking person and appreciates the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Fight Against Shame Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “For against Shame” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. A widow, Isatu has six children. One of her children is in primary school, two are in secondary school, one is in college and the others are no longer attending school. 

Isatu sells clothes for both men and women. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to buy both men and women’s clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy men and women’s clothes in bulk

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Alma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración y distribución de artesanía de tipo platería. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Marivel  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como alambre y otras cosas más.

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marivel was born in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Perú).  She’s 34 years old, married and has three children.  Currently, she’s living in the city of Pisaq where she carries out her activities.  She makes and sells all sorts of silver crafts.  She’s been in this business for 15 years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Marivel wants the loan to buy supplies like wire and other things.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets monthly in Pisaq District, Calca Province, (Cusco, Perú). Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wire and other things.

loans.name: Cantalicia

texts.es:
Cantalicia, se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, ella aprendió el comercio de cosméticos por influencia de unas amigas, lleva 6 años en el negocio, trabaja de 2:00pm a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como: maquillaje, labiales, rubor, sombras, lápiz de ojos, este préstamo la ayudara para mejorar el inventario de materiales para ofrecer a los clientes, nuevos estilos y colores de maquillajes, su única dificultad es que vende al crédito y los clientes no pagan a tiempo la deuda.
El propósito de Cantalicia es trabajar fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia, apoyando a sus hijos y darles la oportunidad de estudiar para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Cantalicia works in cosmetic sales. She lives with her husband and two children, who are 20 and 16 years old. She learned the cosmetics sales business through some friends, and she has been in the business for 6 years. She works from 2 pm to 5 pm.

She is applying for a loan to purchase cosmetics such as make-up, lipsticks, blush, eye shadow, and eye liner. This loan will help her improve the inventory that she offers to customers, with new styles and colors of makeup. Her only difficulty is that she sells on credit, and her customers don't pay their debts on time.

Cantalicia's intention is to work hard to raise her family, supporting her children and giving them a good opportunity to study so that they can aim ever higher.

loans.use: to buy products to sell: make-up, lipstick, blush, eye shadow, and eye liner

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and two young children, who are still attending school. Despite his old age, he is still working in the construction field, as he has since 1980. He is specialized at completing painting work. 

With his requested loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase necessary paints and scaffolding in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase necessary paints and scaffolding.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Doña Anastacia es una mujer con ganas de salir adelante ella vive con uno de sus hijos ya que casi todos son casados, el le ayuda a vender frutas y legumbres en su casa. Ella a veces sale a vender también a las calles de una población cercana a su localidad dice que desde muy temprana hora va a la central de abastos a surtirse de las frutas y legumbres. Doña Anastacia esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ella comprara, cebollas, chiles, jitomates, lechugas, chicharos, zanahorias, chayotes etc. y un poco de abarrotes ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio. El deseo de doña Anastacia es mejorar sus condiciones de vida mas que nada de su casa ya que es de madera y con las inclemencias del clima se le mete el agua. Ella agradece lo que hace la gente através de la financiera ella dice “Dios los siga socorriendo para que nos sigan ayudando através de los créditos”.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a woman with a desire to get ahead in life.  She lives with one of her children as almost all her children are now married.  Her son helps her to sell fruit and vegetables from her home.  Sometimes Anastacia also goes out to the streets of a nearby town to sell her products.  She says that she goes to the wholesale market very early in the morning to stock up with fruit and vegetables.

Anastacia is requesting a loan as she would like to continue investing in her business.  She will buy onions, chilis, tomatoes, lettuces, peas, carrots, chayotes, etc. and also some groceries as she would like to grow her business.  Anastacia's wish is to improve her living conditions and her house because her house is made from wood and when the weather is bad the water seeps in.  She is grateful for what people do through the financial institution.  She says "May God continue to help you so that you continue helping us through these loans".

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old, married, and has nine children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Delia runs an egg business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 24 years.  She  also earns additional income from pig fattening, fishing, and dried fish vending.

Delia is requesting a loan for 29,500 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.  Delia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF.  

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Fady Argenis

texts.es: A sus 32 años de edad Fady es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la confección a terceros, desde hace 5 años monto su propia microempresa, con la ilusión de sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante trabaja todos los días de 8:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. con gran dedicación pues su mayor sueño es poder ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y posicionar su negocio en el mercado, para ello es conciente que debe agilizar sus procesos de producción para mejorar las ventas, pero es necesario tener una máquina que le acorte el tiempo en la confección, pero ella no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para comprar esta máquina por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual hacer esta compra, mejorar las ventas, incrementar sus ingresos y estabilizar su situación económica.
texts.en: At 32 years old, Fady is an enterprising woman who does manufacturing for third parties. Five years ago she opened her own mini-factory with the goal of supporting her two children. She works each day from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm with much dedication since her big dream is to be able to give her two children a better quality of life and to establish her business in the market. For this reason she knows she has to speed up her manufacturing process to improve sales, but she needs to have a machine that saves production time. She doesn’t have enough money to buy this machine so she’s asking for a loan to make this purchase, improve sales, increase income, and stabilize her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to speed up the manufacture process.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking businessman aged 33. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He has been involved with a business of hiring tents for the last three years to bring up his family. He has employed two people to assist him to manage the business. George has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more seats for the tents.

loans.use: To buy more seats for the tents.

loans.name: Avila Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAMA est la représentante du groupe AVILA. Elle est mariée  et mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.07 vont à l’école. Elle a 11 personnes en charge.

Elle est Tisserant  depuis 21ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  naabis yaar en ville .Ses clients sont les voisins.

Elle veut  s’acheter  20 roulots de fils.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariama is the representative of the AVILA group. She is married and mother to eight children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest 3 years old. Seven go to school. She has 11 people under her care.

She has been a weaver for 21 years. She gets her supplies at the naabis yaar [street market] in town. Her clients are her neighbors.

She wants to buy 20 rolls of thread.

With her profits, she wants to strengthen her business. Her goal is to help her husband to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 20 rolls of thread

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
NDIAGA HABITE DANS UN DÉPARTEMENT DE LA RÉGION SUD DU SÉNÉGAL , AGE DE 59 ANS MARIE D'UNE FEMME ET A 7 ENFANTS, UN SEUL EST A L'ÉCOLE ET FAIT LA 3 ieme .
NDIAGA FAIT LE COMMERCE DE LÉGUMES (CAROTTES CHOU MANIOC CITRON ETC...).IL S'APPROVISIONNE A TOUBA MOURIDE POUR VENIR VENDRE DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL DE SA VILLE.
NDIAGA EST DANS LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 32 ANS ET C'EST AVEC QU'IL A EU SA PROPRE MAISON ET A MIS SA FAMILLE DANS DE TRÈS BONNE CONDITION .
texts.en:
Ndiaga lives in a department of South Region in Senegal. He's 59 years old, married, and has seven children. Out of them, only one attends school and is in 9th grade.

Ndiaga sells vegetables (carrots, cabbage, cassava, lemons, etc). He gets his supplies in Touba Mouride and resells at the local market in his town.

Ndiaga has been in this business for more than 32 years, which enabled him to get his own house and offer a very good standard of living to his family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and bolster his stock

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa en una de las calles mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba, sale a su puesto muy temprano ya que el flujo de clientes es mayor durante las mañanas en especial los días de feria (miércoles y sábado),  tiene esposo el no vive con ella, cabe recalcar que es rentista y no tiene hijos por los que velar directamente,  el motivo principal es tener mayor mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Martha sells clothing on one of the busiest streets in the city of Cochabamba. She goes out to her stand very early, as the flow of customers is greater during the mornings, especially on market days (Wednesday and Saturday). 

She has a husband who does not live with her. It is worth emphasizing that she is a retiree, and doesn't have children to care for directly. 

The main reason for the loan is to have more merchandise for the year-end holidays. For this reason, she applied for the loan, in order to buy seasonal clothing. She is a very hard-working person, and feels happy about the opportunity she has been provided.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing as merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Maudiel Marina

texts.es: Maudiel Marina tiene 27 años de edad,  su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos lo cual no tiene mucha competencia, ya que en su zona no hay muchas personas que se dediquen  a estén  tipo de negocio, por lo que este negocio le ha sido muy factible y tener ingresos para la familia. Maudiel tiene el apoyo de su esposo que es cadete de moto taxis de la zona este tipo de trabajo genera poco ingresos, pero ambos luchan para sacar a su familia adelante. Maudiel está solicitando crédito para poder abastecerse de cerdos y por tener producto para esta temporada que es muy buena.
texts.en:
Maudiel Marina is 27 years old. Her business involves butchering pigs. She does not have much competition since there are not many people in her area who engage in this type of business. Therefore, her business is feasible and allows her to generate income for her family. Maudiel has the support of her husband who works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the area. However, this type of work generates little income. Both of them strive to move their family forward.

Maudiel is requesting a loan to acquire pigs so that she will have product on hand since this season is very good.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia Maria tiene 59 años de edad, su actividad económica es una pulpería el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes que la visitan ofreciéndole variedad de productos para el hogar. Esta  actividad lo aprendió de forma  empírica por la necesidad de generar ingresos para la familia y salir adelante. Lesbia Maria está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando variedad de producto como granos básicos, jabones, azúcar, entre otros productos para el hogar que los clientes solicitan.
texts.en: Lesbia Maria is 59 years old, she has a small grocery store located in her home, and she takes care of her customers by offering them a variety of products for the home. She began working by her need to have income for her family and to get ahead in life. Lesbia Maria will use the loan money to invest in her business by buying a variety of products like basic grains, soaps, sugar and other items for the home that her customers need.

loans.use: buy basic grains, soaps, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es: Rosa, quien aparece sentada en la fotografía junto a una niña, pertenece al Banco Comunal Maravilla, de Cañete VIII Región de Chile. En este Banco el principal rubro es el comercio, tales como venta de flores, comida rápida, venta de joyas y ropa. Rosa vende ropa hace 16 años, ella comenzó de ayudante vendiendo puerta a puerta hasta que decidió independizarse. Problemas ha tenido dos muy importantes respecto a su negocio, el primero es que debió cerrar su negocio por problemas personales y el segundo fue que también debió cerrar su negocio por no pago de clientas a las cuales les dio crédito. Esto le ayudo a tener más precaución para su futuro. El dinero que solicita lo ocupará para  comprar ropa y arrendar un nuevo local. Piensa que será un buen tiempo para la venta de ropa, y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder encontrar  coordinación, ayuda y comunicación.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is sitting with a girl in the picture, is a member of Communal Bank “Maravilla,” in the Cañete VIII region, Chile. The group’s members work all with commercial activities, such as selling flowers, fast food, jewelry and clothes. Rosa has been selling clothes for sixteen years. She started as an assistant, selling clothes door-to-door until she decided to become an independent saleswoman.

She has had two big problems with her business. The first one was when she had to close her business due to private issues and the second one was when she had to close it because her customers were not paying on time. These experiences helped her to be more cautious in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes and rent a new establishment. She believes this is a good season to sell clothes. What she likes the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is that she finds coordinated activities, support and communication.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 36 years old, he is a government employee. He is married and has five smart children. Ahmed has a very low salary and he always worries about making enough money and saving some of it for his children’s school expenses. With this loan now he can accommodate all these expenses.
He is requesting a 3000$ loan to pay for his children's tuition fees and other school expenses. He aims to see his children get best education. 
The story of Ahmed and his children is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.en:
ENGLISH TRANSALTION
Hello My name is Catherine cuento.   I run  a small business of sale of firewood and tortillas, located in my house for several years.  This activity generates income to me to cover my personal expenses and other commitments, I am unmarried mother and thanks this business I have been able to move ahead to help my children.  All my children are married and I am single.

ORIGINAL SPANISH
Hola Mi nombre es Catalina cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de leña y elaboracion de tortillas, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion desde hace varios años, actividad que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos personales  y otros compromisos, soy madre soltera y gracias este negocio  he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos, todos mis hijos  se casaron y yo he quedado sola.

loans.use: Compra de leña de roble,leña de ocote y maiz

loans.name: Suarti

texts.en:
Suarti is a member of MBK who has requested her third loan of $100. A portion of the loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her store and the rest will be used to help her husband's farm. In a day Suarti can generate IDR 150,000 of revenue with IDR 10,000 of profit, from which she can send her children to school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Warung

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo lives in a rented house on Tejada Sorzano Avenue in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz; he uses one bedroom and a kitchen. He is 34 years old and is studying culinary arts at the Hotel School, where he is going to finish the course on international cuisine. Currently, he caters for social events, such as weddings, sweet 15 parties, etc. He makes lunch and dinner buffets every weekend, with which he is able to buy food, clothing, and pay for his education.

The loan he is requesting will be used to finish his studies. His history with IMPRO qualifies him as a good client, which is why he is able to take out a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gonzalo vive en casa alquilada en la Av. Tejada Sorzano de la zona de Mira flores de la Ciudad de La Paz, ocupa una habitación y una cocina. Tiene 34 años de edad y es estudiante de la carrera de gastronomía en la Escuela Hotelera donde va a terminar el curso de cocina internacional; actualmente se dedica a la atención de eventos sociales como ser Matrimonios, 15 Años, etc. realiza almuerzos y cenas Buffet cada fin de semana con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y educación, el crédito que solicita es para culminar la carrera. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como buen cliente por consiguiente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en: “I live in a Pakpattan, a small town 200 km from the second largest city Lahore in Pakistan. My husband and I work together to make a living for our five children. While I sew clothes at home for neighbours, my husband would like to purchase a second-hand car to provide taxi service in large cities. We have pooled in some of our savings and looking for an additional amount to make our new business venture possible.”

loans.use: Purchase second car to provide taxi service

loans.name: Hyam

texts.en:
Hyam A. C. is a 38-year-old woman who makes hair extensions. She needs $400 to buy naturA. hair in order to make the extensions and then sell them to a wig producer. Hyam lives in Hay El Selloum, in the Beirut suburbs with her family. The profit she earns is used for her family's living expenses and to reinvest in her business.

Hyam is part of a group with other women. They are a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. Group lending is based on incrementA. increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: To buy natural hair to make the extensions

loans.name: Purificación

texts.en:
Ms. Purificación G. is a 40-year-old mother of four living with her partner, Vidal Cuellar,in Carapeguá, Paraguay. Purificación and her partner have been living together for the past 10 years. Purificación divorced her first husband with whom she has two children. She is now a grandmother, as her oldest daughter now has a child of her own. This is a particularly felicitous event since one of Purification’s own children died within a few months of birth when she was younger. In addition to her partner and youngest child, Purificación also takes care of her aging mother.

For the past 15 years, Purificación has worked in the municipal markets selling new and used clothing. Thanks to this work, she has been able to maintain her family's well-being and also has begun selling other goods in Carapeguá, closer to her home. Her partner, Vidal, is also a vendor and assists her with this work.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of her business including seasonal clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca belongs to the Teresa Ramos community bank and lives in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 44 and the mother of 3 children, all of them adults. Because she is a widow with limited income, with her first loan from Manuel Ramos she put up a small soft drink stand.

She still has that stand, which she attends to along with her children and her daughter-in-law. They all rise very early to take care of the business; although her older children are now economically independent they have never forgotten the great sacrifice their mother maD. for them.

With a loan from Manuel Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a greater amount of products for her soft drink stand, such as 20 cases of carbonated drinks and candy in bulk. Additionally she will expand her stand, for which she will need 2 cords of lumber, 10 calamine plates, 4 cans of paint and 3 kilos of nails.

Francisca is very content to see her business growing and feels that her dreams are coming true without having to depend on others.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Francisca pertenece al banco comunal Teresa Ramos, vive en Jr. Eduardo del Águila 689, del Distrito D. Calleria del departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, todos mayores D. edad, es viuda, por lo que el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Francisca, con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. poner una pequeña fuente D. soda.

En la actualidad cuenta con dicha fuente D. soda, la misma que atienD. junto a sus hijos, y su nuera, se levantan muy temprano para atender el negocio, sus hijos mayores ya se independizaron económicamente pero nunca olvidan el gran sacrificio que hizo su madre por ellos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad D. productos para su fuente D. soda para lo cual, invertirá en 20 cajas D. bebidas gaseosas, golosinas al por mayor, además ampliará su local, para ello necesita 2 cientos D. madera, 10 planchas D. calaminas, 4 baldes D. pintura, y 3 kg. D. clavos.

Francisca está muy contenta porque ve que su negocio prospera y siente que sus sueños se están realizando sin la necesidad D. depender D. otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and candy for resale. Expansion and maintenance of commercial premises.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 30-year-old Neema M.. She is married with one child, aged 7.

In 2004, Neema established a tailoring business. Neema has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase an extra sewing machine, cloth, buttons, needles and zippers.

Neema is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the large majority of clients repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time, ask anxiously, “but how do you make sure people pay back? Won’t they just take the money?”

The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually the ‘poor’) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people. Whether or not this is true is somewhat irrelevant, for a number of reasons.

First, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk.

More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive.

The incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another…The incentive to have ongoing access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

Neema is in the center of the picture, sitting between two of her apprentices.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, material, buttons, needles and zippers.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. S. was married in 1984 and has seven children. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, but the other children live at home and are involved in the weaving business. Mrs. S. and her husband, Chann Vy, are also rice farmers. The family lives in Koh Dach by the Mekong River.

Mrs. S. will use this loan of $200 to purchase silk material for her three children who are weaving at home. This is her fourth loan request.

loans.use: Buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena B. A. runs a general store in the city of Morales, San Martin. Maria offers her community essential products, such as ingredients for popular local dishes, candy, drinks, and hygiene products. She started the store one year ago and has experienced a steady increase of sales.

Maria is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. An ex-school teacher, Maria is content providing this valuable service to her community. Family is very important to Maria. She wants to make sure she continues to have a second income so her children can have more opportunities in life than she has had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Maria is requesting a loan of $300 to repay over 6 months. She plans to use the loan to restock her store with beer, oil, and rice.

loans.use: To restock her store with beer, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jroge is a very hard working individual, and he is married and has a son aged 3 years. When he was born he didn't have a steady job, and there was a great deal of economic uncertainty in his home, which is why he started his business 5 years ago. He purchase a car and since he didn't have s steady job he bought a taxi permit. Today he counts on this job and it provides his family with their needs.

He is requesting a loan of $1125 that he will repay in a term of 6 months to renovate his service station, so that he might provide better costomer service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, esta casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Cuando nació su hijo el no tenia un trabajo estable, había mucha incertidumbre económica en su hogar por lo que hace 5 años empezó su negocio compro un carro, y al no tener un trabajo fijo compro unas placas para operarlo como taxi. Actualmente cuenta con una base de taxis y este trabajo le provee lo necesario para mantener a su familia.

El solicita un crédito por US $1,125 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su estación de servicio para mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: To renovate his service station

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Ever since she had her first opportunity to work Rosario hasn't rested when it's come to work. She has always liked business and once she married her husband she thought about opening her own grocery store. Upon building her house they dedicated space for the store. And today, it has been 25 years since Rosario started managing it, tending to it and helping it grow.

On the other hand, Rosario and her husband, who has already retired from working in a soft drink factory, prepare around 200 tamales on the weekends to sell to friends and family. Thanks to this, the flavorful cooking of Rosario has become known and she frequently receives requests for her tamales for events and parties. In any case, on the weekends she also, apart from selling her tamales and attending to her grocery store, prepares typical platters to also sell at the store.

She only lives with her husband and grandson of 10 years of age, whom they take care of and support. Rosario says that she doesn't receive any allowance from her son to take care of her grandson so she dedicates the money that she receives from renting a room in her house for his expenses. In the future, she would like to convert her grocery store into a bazaar since she considers that would be more more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que tuvo su primera oportunidad de trabajar Rosario no ha descansado nunca cuando de trabajo se trataba. A ella siempre le gusto el negocio y una vez que se caso con su esposo pensó en abrir una bodega propia. Al construir su casa designaron un espacio para ambientar el local de su bodega. Y hoy ya hace veinticinco años que Rosario se encarga de manejarla, de atender y de hacerla crecer.

Por otro lado, Rosario y su esposo quien ya e jubilado por trabajar en una fábrica de bebidas gasificadas, preparan alrededor de 200 tamales los fines de semana para venderlos amigos y familiares. Gracias a esto, la sazón de Rosario se ha hecho conocida y frecuentemente recibe pedidos de tamales para algunos eventos o fiestas. De todos modos, ella los fines de semana a parte de vender sus tamales y de atender en su bodega, prepara algunos platos típicos y los vende en su bodega también.

Ella vive únicamente con su esposo y con su nieto de diez años, a quien cuida y mantiene también. Rosario cuenta que no recibe ninguna pensión de su hijo para el cuidado de su nieto es así que destina el dinero que recibe por el alquiler de una habitación en su casa para los gastos de él. Más adelante ella desearía convertir su bodega en un bazar pues lo considera más rentable.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat S. sells foodstuffs at Iba Community located at the northern part of Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She is very determined to pull her family out of poverty. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She acquired the skill of trading for 10 years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sales.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Betti Dori

texts.es:
Betti is a determined woman and constant in what she does. Her great courage and effort has been worthwhile, because more than 18 years ago she undertook to open her own business alone: her convenience store. Her motivation was her son; to give him all that he needed. Today her son is an honest man and his only support always was Betti. Upon fulfilling the noble task of being both father and mother for him, he has now finished his university studies. Betti needs a loan to be able to increase the merchandise of her convenience store and to buy new showcases and shelves for the exhibition of her products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Betti es una mujer luchadora y constante en lo que hace, su gran valor y esfuerzo le ha valido para que por más de 18 años emprenda ella sola su propio negocio, su bodega. Su motivación fue su hijo, darle todo lo necesario. Hoy su hijo ya es un hombre de bien y su único sostén siempre fue Betti que al cumplir la noble tarea de ser padre y madre para él, ahora, él debe terminar sus estudios universitarios. Betti necesita un préstamo para poder incrementar la mercadería de su bodega y comprar nuevas vitrinas y estantes para la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To acquire new merchandise for her wine cellar as well as new showcases and shelves.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 40 years old and married with three children.  She currently manages a business that produces and sells bricks to customers, but she also has a shop where she sells general building supplies.  Because Toyin gives financially unstable customers a one-month grace period, she has been able to attract many customers over the years.  She employs several young men who are paid on a daily basis and help her produce bricks.  Toyin now needs a loan of $700 which will help her purchase more materials for making bricks.

loans.use: To purchase materials for brick-making.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat (his son is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1962. He is married and has 2 children. Ten years ago, he started his farming business.  Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy seedlings for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Azusena

texts.es: La Sra. Azusena Julieta González, ha montado un Cyber Café, enla zona céntrica de la ciudad, debido a la insistencia de clientes en que la propietaria solicite los servicio de carga para celulares de las líneas  Personal y Tigo, ha solicitado crédito con la Fundación para dicho efecto, hoy cuenta también con el servicio ya mencionado, siendo así uno de los negocios con mayor éxito.
texts.en:
Azusena has set up a cyber-cafe in the city center to meet demand from users of Personal and Tigo cell phone services. She has applied to Fundacion for a loan to set up the cyber-cafe with the understanding that providing cell phone services is a business that has proven to be very successful for others.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercederías

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reya E. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de perecederos o verduras en el mercado de central de Chinandega donde se desempeña desde hace cinco años.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha esforzado grandemente y por este motivo ha doblado sus esfuerzos para así seguir supliendo las necesidades de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo. El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el dinero para la compra de los perecederos para ofertarlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reya E. is a lady whose business is the sale of perishable goods and vegetables in the central market of Chinandega where she has worked for the past five years.

It is important to point out that she is has worked very hard and for this reason she has doubled her efforts to continue supplying her home’s necessities that need her support so much. The reason why she is waiting for Ceprodel is to obtain the money for the purchase of the perishable goods in order to offer them to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods.

loans.name: Phang

texts.en:
Mrs. Phang N. is a farmer and lives in Ang Prasath village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Phang N. is 59 years-old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the third is a construction worker. Her husband, Mr. Sam Buth, is an invalid and cannot help support the family.

She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her land is infertile, which has a negative effect on her crops. Mrs. N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her land and to make her crops more productive. She'll use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a breeding cow

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Alondras (“Larks”) Village Bank. Eulalia is 46 years old and married with four children. Eulalia has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market where she sells a variety of bread, which she buys from local bakeries. Eulalia also sells homemade gelatin desserts; she sells both bread and gelatin seven days a week.  

Now, Eulalia is in need of a loan of 1000 soles to buy fruitcakes for the Christmas season. Eulalia dreams of improving her house and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy fruitcake to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en: Zaman K. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his wife and three children. He owns and manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as tea, candies, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. He built his own store nine years ago, and he is proud that he does not need to spend money for space rental. Zaman has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. Zaman is requesting this loan to purchase more foodstuffs for his store and thus increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventories for his store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 52 años D. edad, tiene 05 hijos, es casada y no posee estudios.
Trabaja hace 02 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorD. y venta D. ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar sus vacunos. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para poder adquirir ganado (02 toros) y continuar dedicándose al engorD. y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Pilcuyo o Ilave. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ayudar en los estudios superiores D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Miraflores” located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao. She is 52 years old, has five children, is married, and has no education. She has worked for 2 years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business consists of the purchase, raising, and sale of cattle. Her first loan was for 500 new soles and that helped her purchase feed for her cattle. With this loan of 2000 new soles, which will be repaid in three months, Rosa will purchase two bulls, and continue raising her other cattle and sell them at the fairs. Her earnings from that will allow her to help with the costs of her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of 2 bulls and feed for her cattle

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar is a hard-working person, and he makes an effort to give his four beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.

With experience gained over 7 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 2500 Somoni. Anvar thanks you very much for your love of the less fortunate.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Goundo

texts.fr:
Née en 1962 à Bamako, Madame Goundo D. est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est vit avec son mari  et ses enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville  de koutiala (  Région de Sikasso ).  
Enseignante dans une école publique de koutiala ville, elle exerce également des  activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la vente de tissus, pagnes wax et autres articles depuis 15 ans.  Jouissant d’une bonne notoriété,  elle reçoit des commandes à travers les associations féminines lors des cérémonies et surtout à l’approche des fêtes telle le 8 Mars (journée internationale de la  femme).
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans.   Après 4 prêts solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 6 ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 60 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Mme Goundo  effectue sa vente dans les différentes entreprises de koutiala et sur commande à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 160.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt,  subvenir aux besoins familiaux et élargir son activité.
 Animée de grandes ambitions, Mme Goundo a pour perspective d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus et d’autres produits au grand marché de koutiala.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Bamako, Mrs. Goundo D. is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

She is a teacher in a public school in the town of Koutiala, but has also earned income selling fabrics, "wax pagnes" (high quality, colorful African print cloth), and other items for 15 years. She enjoys an excellent reputation and receives orders through women's associations for ceremonies and above all before such holidays as March 8 (International Women's Day).

In order to satisfy the needs of her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 4 solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her 6th individual loan, the preceding having been repaid without difficulty.

With this loan, she plans to buy 60 lengths of "wax pagne" in Bamako (capital of Mali). Mrs. Goundo does her selling in the various companies in Koutiala and to order to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash or on credit.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 160,000 F CFA which she plans to use to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover family expenses, and expand her business. Inspired by great ambition, Mrs. Goundo hopes one day to open a shop selling fabric and other items in the big open-air market of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "wax pagnes"

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Emerita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Tacna S/Nº, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 3000.00, por iniciativa propia emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Emerita, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Emerita is a member of the “Doradinas en Acción” Community Bank and lives on Tacna Lane in the San José de Sisa district of San Martín. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of one dependent child.

She used her first loan, for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, to start her own small business selling groceries. Since her initial loan, she has continued selling groceries from a shop located in her home. Her customers are mainly her neighbors and friends.

With this loan, for 1,000 nuevos soles (to be repaid in four months), she will purchase more merchandise to stock her shop. These items will include rice, bags of sugar, personal hygiene products, cleaning supplies, and soft drink mix as well as other merchandise to keep her customers happy.

Emerita is in charge of making the decisions about her business. Personally, she feels more independent, secure, and responsible with the loan repayments.

Emerita expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as a businessperson and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, bags of sugar, personal hygiene products, cleaning supplies, and soft drink mix

loans.name: Mbougane

texts.fr: Madame Mbougane D. a commencé à faire le commerce depuis l’âgé très jeune.  Son activité consiste à vendre du thieré (du couscous en mil) et le fonde.  Le fonde est une bouilli (un pudding) qui est fait avec de la farine de mais pilé et du lait caillé que les Sénégalais mangent pour le petit déjeuner.  Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter du mil et du mais pour préparer ses produits.  Madame D. est âgée de 52 ans.  Elle habite à Thiès avec son mari, et avec les revenus de son entreprise elle paye les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mbougane D. started in commerce at a very young age. Her work involves selling thieré (made of couscous and millet) and fonde, which is a pudding that is made with pounded cornmeal and curdled milk that the Senegalese eat for breakfast. With this loan, she's going to buy some millet and corn to make these products. Ms. D. is 52 years old. She lives in Thiès with her husband. With the revenues from her enterprise, she covers the expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet and corn

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 34 ans, mariée et père de 3 enfants. Komla réside à Wome, où il fait des pépinières des jeunes plants. Il revend ces derniers aux cultivateurs et organisations. Ses plants sont très sollicités par la population à cause de l’entretien qu’il donne à ses jeunes plants. Komla est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.
texts.en:
Komla A., 34, is married and the father of 3 children. Komla resides in Wome, where he has nurseries with young plants. He sells them to farmers and organizations. His plants are very much in demand because he takes such care in raising them. Komla is on his second loan and his reimbursements have been regular.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of soil amendments and fast-growing plants

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: M. Magret is a 38-year-old businesswoman. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are going to school. She has been in the clothes business for over 6 years. She deals in baby clothes, and her shop is located in Kampala town. She will use this loan to purchase baby clothes to sell. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and work hand-in-hand with her husband to educate their children.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: H. Alice est née le 08 Aout 1976 à Hanzounmè  dans la Commune d'Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  Alice est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) scolarisés ; le troisième n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. C’est dans cette Commune d'Akpro Missérété que réside Alice et sa famille.  Alice est coiffeuse de formation et de profession. Alice a besoin d’agrandir et de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour une plus grande capacité de ses prestations à cause de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante. C’est pourquoi Alice sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Alice was born on August 8, 1976 in Hanzounmè in the community of Akpro Missérété in Ouémé County. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school; the third one is not yet old enough to go to school. The community of Akpro Missérété is where Alice resides with her family. She is a hairdresser by training and by profession. She needs to expand and to equip her salon better to offer a larger service capacity. This is because her customers are constantly growing in number. For these reasons, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, shampoos, straighteners, ointments, and some hairdresser tools

loans.name: Hamet Boubacar

texts.fr: Hamet boubacar  S.   est un mécanicien garagiste   il fait de la réparation et de l’entretien des automobiles .pour diversifier son activité il sollicite un prêt lui permettant de monter une station de lavage de véhicule dans son garage.
texts.en:
Hamet Boubacar S. is a garage mechanic. He repairs and services automobiles. In order to diversify his business activity he is asking for a loan that will allow him to set up a car wash station in his garage.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a car wash station

loans.name: Насрулло

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муминов Насрулло мужчина , который занимается  куплей и откормом скота
Сам работает водителем маршрутного такси. Его доход хватает на жизнь, но для ремонта своего дома ему необходим дополнительный доход. Поэтому прибыль своего бизнеса животноводства он использует на осуществление своих планов. Он благодарен инвесторам  за  понимание и финансирование.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is 40 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Cristita has been in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cristita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and for her family's daily food.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena U. tiene 62 años. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio con ropa variada ofrecía su ropa en las comarcas en algunos departamentos, el desafío de Ivania con este negocio fue que no tenia transporte propio por lo que algunas veces se quedaba hospedada en otros lugares y esto le ocasionaba gastos extras que tenía que pagar hospedaje. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisetas, faldas, calzados y shorts. Su deseo es mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que en las temporadas de lluvia tiene problemas en su casa.
texts.en:
Ivania Azucena U. is a 62 year old woman who enjoys working. For more than 18 years, she has been selling general merchandise. She started selling clothes in different parts of the district, but she didn’t have a way to take her merchandise with her. She would have to incur additional expenses to pay someone to transport her goods. In most of the places where she went, she was already paying a hosting fee to secure a space where she could sell her products.

Ivania has requested a loan to use as working capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shoes, and shorts. She hopes to make repairs to the roof of her house because she experiences problems during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Roth Kong Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eleven people all living in Smaong village in Takeo province, is requesting a loan. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Ev Mei, is a driver who gets little salary. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom stays at home while another attends the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas, Group 1, 2, 3

texts.en:
Teresita runs a small market stall selling clothes, food and other items.  She has operated her store for over eight years and her loans have allowed her to increase her business by 80%.  She plans to use this loan to buy a box of used clothes and food items to sell.  She has successfully repaid two loans and this will be her third loan with Esperanza.  Teresita is single and has three grown children.  She wants to continue to increase her business and add more products to her store. 
 
Teresita is the group coordinator of the Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Activas (Active Women).  Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR).  The group is based in Puerto Plata in a community that has unreliable access to running water and electricity and lacks trash service.

loans.use: A box of used clothing and food items to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Lacer who is 29 years old and works as a tricycle driver. They are blessed with three children, two are already studying and the youngest is one year old.  

Jennifer is a vendor in their village. In the morning she sells meat, fish, chicken and longganisa (a type of sausage).  In the afternoon, she sells different snacks like pansit, native cakes, ice candy, and bananas. She patiently retails her products from house to house to earn a living.  She can see that her business is growing and for it to become more productive she has requested a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7,000.  She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha N. is 41 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 8 to 15 years old. Josepha lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately 3 hours drive from Kigali, the capital city. Josepha owns and operates a business where she sells a great variety of goods. She would like to add handbags to her offering.  A proven entrepreneur, this is her tenth year in this business and she employs four people from her community. Her business requires that she works from 6 AM to 6 PM every day.

Josepha is a seasoned businesswoman. She is requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase handbags to sell. It should be noted that her first loan was paid on time and in full. The success of her business, partially enabled through this loan, continues to help her to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: More inventory, specifically handbags

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 44 años de edad.  Tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica de Isidora es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Su negocio nació por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos, para el sustento diario de su familia, por lo que diario salía a vender ciertas golosinas pero esto lo pero ya estaba cansada de viajar todos los días. Y se ubico en su vivienda. Ella solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo e invertir el dinero en materia prima como golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos naturales, pan y gaseosas. Su sueño es que su pequeño negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Isidora is 44 years old. She has 4 children, but none depend on her. Isidora's economic activity is a grocery store. For more than 20 years, she has been dedicated to her business. The location of her business is at her home. Her business started with the need to obtain a source of income for the daily living of her family. Prior to that, she sold some candy, but she became very tired of commuting every day, and now she is located at her home. She is requesting a loan for working capital and to invest the money in raw materials such as candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda. Her dream is that her small business will turn into a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es: Don Marcos Rodríguez es un hombre trabajador desde que salio del ejercito de Nicaragua le dieron una pensión el cual con este dinero monto su propio negocio desde hace quince años vendiendo lentes, relojes, lámparas de noche, alarmas entre otro en la cotran del Mayoreo en donde vende ambulante por que solicito un permiso para vender ambulante dentro de la misma. Ya que es donde salen todas las unidad de buses a los diferente departamento del norte. Gracias a los préstamo que Afodenic a  otorgado ha logrado mantener su inventario, por que las ventas en los últimos meses han sido baja a demás el tiene que comprar su almuerzo ya que desde horas temprana sale con su venta para poder lograr vender. Con este préstamo que es temporada navideña desea invertir en la compra de billetera, calculadoras, gorras, relojes para dama y caballero como una variedad de lentes para atraer clientes y lograr que sus ventas aumenten para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su esposa y sus dos hijos ya que de su fuente de trabajo subsisten.
texts.en:
Marcos is a hard-working man. When he left the Nicaraguan Army he received a pension and with this money he began his business, selling glasses, watches, night lights, alarm clocks, among other things, in Managua's Mayoreo market. He is a mobile vendor who has obtained permission to sell there. This is where all buses depart for the northern departments.

Thanks to loans provided through AFODENIC, he has been able to maintain his inventory, although in recent months his sales have been low. Since he must start selling very early if he wants to succeed, he has to buy his own lunch.

With this loan for Christmas season Marcos wants to buy billfolds, calculators, caps, and watches for ladies and gentlemen, as well as a variety of glasses, to attract customers, increase sales and satisfy the needs of his wife and his 2 children, who depend on his source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POCKET BOOKS, BILLFOLDS, CAPS, CALCULATORS AND GLASSES TO INCREASE BUSINESS

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
